loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna, a nice woman from the Ararat region, is a young agronomist. She lives with her husband and 9-year-old daughter. Anna's husband works at a local factory, so the largest part of the work around the farm falls to Anna. She cultivates eggplant and tomatoes and sells the harvest in local markets.
 
The requested loan is very important for this young farmer to develop her cultivation work. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and fuel for land cultivation. Anna hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is a married woman who has three children who all attend school. She operates a ladies' shoes selling business. Her earnings are a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES so she can purchase additional women's shoes. The profit from her business will definitely help her to provide for her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase additional women's shoes.

loans.name: Nooruzgul

texts.ru: Ноорузгуль 34 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Ноорузгуль - среднее образование, с 2010 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Ноорузгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 6 овец, также есть 1,40 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает пшеницу и клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Экологически чистая и вкусная сельскохозяйственная продукция Ноорузгуль пользуется большим спросом, принося ежемесячный доход около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы с теленком. Доходы от кредита помогут Ноорузгуль развить ее бизнес и накопить средства на образование ее детей.
texts.en: Nooruzgul is 34 years old, married, and has three children. Nooruzgul has an intermediate education, and since 2010 she has farmed and raised livestock. Thanks to her persistent work Nooruzgul currently owns two cows and six sheep, and has 1.40 hectares of irrigated land where she raises wheat and clover for farm use and sale. There is a large demand for her ecologically clean and delicious products, and they bring her a monthly income of around 10,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her business she approached the Bai-Tushum Bank for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy a cow and calf. Income from use of the loan will help Nooruzgul develop her business and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase one cow with calf in order to increase her number of livestock, be more profitable and pay for her children's education

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las emprendedoras, donde cada una de ellas está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permite conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Etelvina quien vende carbón, su trabajo es muy humilde, pero lo hace para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella se define a si misma como una mujer que quiere salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares por medio de su trabajo y lucha.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carbón en cantidad y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo  seguir mejorando por medio de su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Emprendedoras" (The Enterprisers).
All of its members are taking the survey for the eradication of poverty conducted by Fundación Paraguaya, which allows this field partner to know the living conditions of each of the women in the group.

Ms. Etelvina is one of the members of this group. She sells charcoal, a humble job; but she does it to be able to provide for her family and loved ones.

She defines herself as a woman who wants to get ahead and help her relatives through her work and her struggle.

She requests this loan to buy charcoal in bulk so that she can go on selling it, as she has always done, and continue to improve by working. She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving, since it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for retail

loans.name: Jose Nahun

texts.es:
José de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta el bachillerato contador, pues lo hiso con mucho esfuerzo, ya que depende de una familia de pocos recursos económicos.

 él trabajo como 7 meses en una tienda, oportunidad que luego aprovecho para poner su propia tienda en el lugar donde vive, él es soltero pero muy trabajador, ya que además de la tienda apoya a sus padres en los trabajos agrícolas, (cultiva maíz y frijol) él ya tiene varios años de tener la tienda de la cual depende la familia, que inicio con poco y ahora la tiene bien surtida.

El préstamo que está solicitando,  es para comprar un molino, pues en el caserío donde él vive no hay y a la gente de ahí le toca caminar muy lejos a los otros caseríos a quebrar el maíz. Con este apoyo económico se le ayudara mucho, pues considera que mejorara la situación económica de la familia, sus planes a futuro son cultivar una parcela de café y mejorar su casa, pues la que tiene es de adobe y no está en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Jose is 26 years old. He stayed in school through high school, studying accounting, and he did it through much effort, given that he comes from a family with few economic resources. He worked for about seven months in a store, an opportunity he took advantage of to later open his own store in the place where he lives. He is single but very hardworking--besides the store he supports his parents in their agricultural jobs (growing corn and beans). For several years now he has had the store that supports his family, which he began with little and which is now well-stocked.

The loan that he is requesting is for purchasing a mill. In the group of houses where he lives, there is none and people from there have to walk a long way to other groups of houses to break up their corn.

This economic aid will help him a lot. He believes it will improve the family's economic situation. His future plans are to plant a plot of land with corn and to improve his house, because the one that he has is made of adobe and it is not in good condition.

loans.use: to buy a mill, because in the group of houses where he lives, there is none and people from there have to walk a long way to other groups of houses to break up their corn.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 22-year-old. married. mother of one child. She started running her own clothes selling business from her house in 2012. She started the business to support her beloved husband in making their living and covering their increasing living expenses.

She is a hard worker, well known in her region for her special products and the encouraging prices she sets. She is trying her best to develop her business, but her family's increasing needs stops her from saving any extra money to expand and develop her current business.

That's why she is asking for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase and diversify her business merchandise with a special autumn and winter collection, since she can't afford to save money for this reason.

This is her third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and she has a good standing in her history of paying back her loans. Her previous loans were invested in developing her business in a well managed way.

She hopes that in the future she can expand her work more and move to an attractive location soon.

loans.use: to increase and diversify her business merchandise with a special autumn and winter collection.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana, a farmer from Aygavan village, is occupied with agriculture. She is a mother of three sons (ages 17, 15 and 13 years old). Liana works at a local flower shop as a seller, and besides that she is also involved in farming business. 

Her husband is a driver who also greatly helps Liana with farming activities. Liana is mainly involved in the cultivation of sunflowers, but she also gets income from her small orchard where different fruit trees are grown (peach, plum, quince, nut, pear and apple). 

Liana has now applied for this loan to be able to invest in her farm and increase the cultivation work. She asks lenders to support her with the purchasing of wheat seeds (300 kg), pesticides and fertilizer needed for the farm. 

She hopes and relies for lenders' support in collecting the needed amount of money.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds (300 kg), pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Santos Domingo

texts.es:
Santos de 28 años de edad, es un hombre que estudio hasta 4° grado, depende de una familia que siempre se han dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijol, un trabajo que requiere de mucha dedicación y que no es muy rentable. Sin embargo, da la oportunidad de auto emplearse y que por lo menos tener para acompañar el platillo con otro tipo de comida.  La esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, mientras que sus 2 hijos asisten a la escuela y por las tardes o en fines de semana le ayudan al padre en el trabajo agrícola.

 Él recuerda que trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenía los 12 años, el lugar donde trabaja se encuentra a media hora de la casa y se traslada caminando. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para la recolección del maíz y el frijol, ya que hay que tapiscar el maíz y arrancar el frijol, para trasladarlo a la casa, eso ultimo lo hace cargándolo en su espalda y como es bastante, pagara personas que le ayuden.
texts.en:
Santos, age 28, went to school through the fourth grade.  He is from a family that has always grown corn and beans.  This work requires a lot of dedication, and it is not very profitable.  However, it provides the opportunity to be self-employed, and he can at least provide some type of food.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores while their two children go to school.  In the afternoons or on the week-ends they help their father with the agricultural work.

He remembers working in agriculture since he was 12 years old.  His work is a half hour from his house, and he gets there by walking.

The loan that he is requesting is to harvest the corn and beans.  You have to break the corn from the stalk and pull up the beans in order to transport it to his house.  He transports it by carrying it on his back.  Because there is a lot, he will pay people to help him.

loans.use: to harvest the corn and beans.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 26 years old. He is married to Rachel and together they have been blessed with 2 children. 

James is a farmer who raises and sells livestock. He has done this business for the last 20 years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs. 40,000.

James has requested Kshs. 30,000 for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase additional livestock to raise.

With the anticipated profits, James will be able to pay back his loan as well as improve his home. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be blessed together with his family so that they can extend their blessings to others.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is an 18-year-old single man from Khanyounis. He lives in a small, simple house in the city with his family. He works in transferring units for the prepaid mobile system for local clients. It is a good business and profitable, but Abdallah needs a new laptop for his work.

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his business so he can transfer units for the prepaid system easily. This will improve his job and also his income.

Abdallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his business so he can transfer units for the prepaid system easily.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 33-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of seven and 15 years, all of whom go to school. Rose, who has been selling foodstuffs for the past 10 years, has requested this loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. She will reinvest her profits into the business.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es un hombre divorciado pero dedicado a sus dos hijos que viven con él. La familia vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad, afortunadamente ellos viven con comodidad Juan es arquitecto restaurador de obras de arte, Juan quiere un credito para comprar herramientas que le ayuden con su trabajo de restaurador con el fin de ganar dinero extra realizando trabajos en su tiempo libre Juan es la unica fuente de ingresos para sus hijos pero goza de buena salud y ya tiene un par de proyectos planeados para empezar con su actividad de restaurador
texts.en: Juan is divorced but looks after his children who live with him. The family lives in a house made of bricks and cement in La Paz. Juan owns the house. The family lives comfortably fortunately. Juan is an architect and art restorer. He wants a loan in order to buy tools that will help him to work as a restorer so that he can earn extra money doing this in his free time. Juan is the only source of income for his children. He is in good health and has a couple of plans for starting to work as an art restorer.

loans.use: to buy tools that will help him in his work as a restorer.

loans.name: Leandro Bladimir

texts.es:
Leandro tiene 24 años de edad, esta casado, estudio hasta quinto grado. Desde hace 4 años, su señora se dedica a los oficios domésticos, Leandro también es electricista a parte de dedicarse a la agricultura, con él viven 4 personas mas, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y fue su papé quien le enseño este trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar adobe y lamina para mejorar su vivienda.

Le gustaría en un futuro poder expandir la familia y tener su primer hijo, ahorita por problemas de salud no puede aun, pero a futuro desea que si se pueda.
texts.en:
Leandro is 24 years old. has a fifth grade education. He has been married for four years; his wife takes care of the household chores. In addition to working as a farmer, Leandro is an electrician. He has been a farmer for seven years, having learned the trade from his father. Leandro lives with four people.

This loan will be used  to buy adobe blocks and metal sheeting to improve Leandro's home.

In the future, Leandro would like to have a family. Just now, due to health problems, he cannot have his first child but he would like to do this in the future.

loans.use: to buy adobe blocks and metal sheeting to improve his home.

loans.name: Un Pie Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
MARIA es madre de 4 hijos, quien fue abandonada  hace 4 años por el padre de sus hijos. Ella ha trabajado diariamente para poder mantener a sus hijos y poder brindarles educación, salud, vivienda y alimentación.
Es una bendición que FODEMI apoye a personas en estado de vulnerabilidad, en especial a mujeres que no tienen la oportunidad de trabajar. Es por eso que con el primer crédito que realizó. Inició el negocio de venta de embutidos y lácteos que traía desde Colombia.
Le ha ido muy bien y esta vez incrementará la venta de productos por catalogo.
Al cabo de 3 años ella espera tener 2 vitrinas abarrotadas para ofrecer mejor sus productos de perfumería y cosmetología. Además desea vender ropa por catalogo.
Sus hijos asisten normalmente a clases y se sienten orgullosos de su madre quien trabaja mucho para que ellos estén bien.
MARIA se siente muy agradecida con los inversionistas por brindarle la oportunidad de trabajar dignamente en su propio negocio y apoyar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is the mother of four children. She was abandoned four years ago by the father of her children. She has worked every day to be able to support her children and offer them education, health, housing, and food.

It is a blessing that FODEMI supports people in a state of vulnerability, especially women who don't have the opportunity to work. It is for this reason that with the first loan she took out, she set up her business of selling cold cuts and dairy products that she brings from Colombia. It has gone very well for her, and now she will increase her sale of products by catalog.

At the end of three years, she hopes to have two stocked display cases in order to better offer her perfume and cosmetic products. In addition, she wants to sell clothing by catalog.

Her children attend classes normally, and they feel proud of their mother, who works hard so that they are well cared for.

Maria feels grateful to the investors for offering her the opportunity to work with dignity in her own business and support her children.

loans.use: to increase her sales of catalog products and continue with her sales of cold cuts and dairy products.

loans.name: Lewela

texts.en:
Lewela is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past year, her potential customers being mostly ladies. In addition, she also operates a retail shop business which earns her another source of livelihood. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan of 40,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase a hair dryer machine for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer machine for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus 2 Group

texts.es:
19 son las señoras que se unieron en este grupo para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras. Son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para trabajar de manera unida. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, trabajando y luchando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lorenza ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, a través de su trabajo y su esfuerzo. Lorenza tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, trabajando y luchando por capacitarse y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, comestibles, bebidas, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
19 women got together in this group in order to help each other. They are women who are heads of household that came together in order to work in unity. They are in the poverty elimination program, working and fighting. 

One of the members is Lorenza. She is improving her poverty situation through her work and effort. Lorenza has a small grocery store, where she works every day starting very early, working and fighting to better herself and move forward.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy products for her store such as vegetables, fruits, groceries, beverages, and other things in order to continue with her sales, fighting to improve.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, groceries, beverages, and other things in order to continue with her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pour acheter des céréales

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Desde su niñez a Francisco le intereso el hecho de poder tener un negocio, administrar el dinero, liderar en una empresa, ahora está tratando de cumplirlo,  escogió estudiar administración de empresas porque se considera una persona proactiva, capaz de tomar decisiones, la dirección y el liderazgo, son parte de su personalidad, Francisco considera que para ser un buen profesional necesita profundizar, ampliar y mejorar sus conocimientos para proyectarse y ser un profesional competente en el mercado laboral, es decir, superarse y cumplir sus metas que desde niño quiso cumplir, sus estudios son lo más importante y primordial y hasta el momento lo ha demostrado siendo un buen estudiante y enfocado en sus estudios y metas.
Francisco desea poder reforzar todos sus conocimientos adquiridos en su universidad, pero desea seguir avanzando intelectualmente, de esa manera, solicita el crédito para un postgrado en Gestión Financiera y un curso de inglés, ya que estos le permitirán encontrar un empleo acorde a sus habilidades, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento que le ayudaran a culminar sus estudios con éxito, y podrá desempeñarse en su campo laboral, en el área laboral Francisco se caracteriza por ser sociable, responsable, trabajador, y con una increíble habilidad de relacionarse en los grupos y trabajar eficazmente. Sus metas próximas son culminar su investigación documental con éxito, graduarse y también terminar los estudios que le garantizaran el crédito.
texts.en:
Ever since his childhood Franciso has been interested in being able to have a business, to manage money, and to lead a company.  He is now trying to make it happen.  He chose to study business administration because he considers himself to be a proactive person who is capable of making decisions.  Directing and leadership are part of his personality.

Francisco believes that to be a good professional you need to carefully study, expand, and improve your knowledge in order to apply yourself and to be a competent professional in the work market.  That is to say that he wants to succeed and to meet the goals that he has wanted to meet since he was a boy.  His education is most important and primordial.  To date he has shown this by being a good student and focusing on his education and his goals.

Francisco wishes to be able to strengthen the knowledge he has acquired at his university.  He wishes to continue advancing intellectually.  He is requesting the loan for postgraduate studies in financial and market management and an English course.  These courses will allow him to find a job that is commensurate with his abilities.

He puts his faith in the loan, and that you will help him successfully complete his education.  Then he will be able to work in his field.  Francisco is known for being gregarious, responsible, and hard-working.  He is known for having an incredible ability to relate to groups and to work efficaciously.  His next goals are to successfully complete his research, to graduate, and to complete his education, which the loan will assure him of doing.

loans.use: to pay for postgraduate studies and and English course.

loans.name: Keziya

texts.en: Keziya is a 23-year-old married mother of two children aged two and six years, one of whom goes to school. Keziya, who has been selling shoes for the past three years, has requested this loan to buy more shoes to sell. Her profits will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Fátima Zuleyma

texts.es:
Fátima de  21 años de edad, estudio hasta 8ª  grado, es madre soltera de un hij de 8 meses, su madre vive con ella por lo que son dos personas que dependen económicamente de ella .

Fátima actualmente trabaja en vender tortillas y tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este oficio que aprendió por parte de su madre,  ya que ella hacia lo mismo.  Ademas, de las tortillas, posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad  en su casa, no tiene que salir pero si levantarse muy temprano a prepara el maíz para las tortillas esto lo hace a las 5 pm que es cuando la mayoría de clientes  llegaran a comprar las tortillas; luego se dedica a cuidar a su hijo de 8 meses.   


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas productos para surtir su tienda, como leche, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, embutidos, bebidas, sal, condimentos, canela, etc.  y a si poder vender mas. 

Los sueños de Fátima es ver crecer a su hijo, poder tener una casa propia porque donde vive es de su madre sabe que sera un reto, pero confiá en Dios que lo lograra.
texts.en:
Fatima, who is 21 years old, went to school through 8th grade. She is a single mother of an eight-month-old son. Her mother lives with her, and so there are two people who depend on her economically.

Fatima now works selling tortillas. For five years she has done this work, which she learned from her mother, since she did the same thing. In addition to the tortillas, she has a store with basic necessities in her house. She doesn't have to go out, but she gets up very early to prepare the corn for the tortillas. She makes these at 5 pm, which is when the majority of her customers arrive to buy the tortillas. Then she takes care of her eight-month-old son.

The loan that she is applying for is to buy more products to stock her store, such as milk, rice, beans, sugar, cold cuts, beverages, salt, condiments, cinnamon, etc., and thus be able to sell more.

Fatima's dreams are to see her son grow and to be able to have her own house, because the place where she lives is her mother's. She knows that this will be a challenge, but she is confident in God that she will achieve it.

loans.use: to buy more products to stock her store, such as milk, rice, beans, sugar, cold cuts, beverages, salt, condiments, cinnamon, etc., and thus be able to sell more.

loans.name: Ulkhan

texts.ru: Улхан отзывчивая, трудолюбивая молодая женщина. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем, но детей еще не имеет. Улхан живет в районе Джиликуль с мужем, свекровью и свекорю. Семья мужа занимается дехканством. Они имеют небольшой участок земли, на котором выращивают сельскохозяйственные культуры. Улхан сама с детства знакома с техникой выращивания сельхозкультур и поэтому ей не было трудно в доме мужа заниматься сельским хозяйством. Растениеводством Улхан уже занимается 6 лет. В данный момент она и семья мужа проводят озимые посевы. Для завершения посевных работ, им не хватает еще немного семян и минеральных удобрений. Улхан берет кредит, чтобы приобрести необходимые семена и удобрения. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Ulkhan is a responsible hard working young woman. She is 25 years old. She is married but doesn't have children yet. Ulkhan lives in the Jilikul area with her husband and in-laws. Ulkhan herself has been familiar with agricultural techniques since childhood so it wasn't hard for her to begin farming at her husband's house. Ulkhan has been growing plants for six years already. Currently she and her husband's family are planting for winter. To finish the winter planting they need a few more seeds and fertilizer. Ulkhan is requesting a loan to obtain the needed seeds and fertilizer. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for winter planting

loans.name: Qurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул женщина фермер, проживающая в сельском районе Джиликуль. Ей 62 года. Она трудолюбивая женщина и зарабатывать на жизнь собственным честным трудом. Последние 6 лет Курбонгул занимается растениеводством. Она на орошаемом участке земли сеет хлопок и другие сельскохозяйственные культуры. Вести сельское хозяйство ей помогают сыновья. Сама Курбонгул не боится тяжелой сельской работы, к которому привыкла с детства. В данный момент она активно готовится к посевам хлопка и из-за нехватки финансов обратилась за кредитом. Курбонгул целеустремленная женщина. В будущем она хочет заняться еще и животноводством.
texts.en: Qurbongul is a woman farmer living in a rural area of Jilikul. She is 62 years old. She is a hard working woman and supports herself with honest labor. She has been farming for the past six years. She plants cotton and other agricultural products on her land plot. Her sons help with the farm. Qurbongul herself isn't afraid of hard outdoor work, which she has been familiar with since childhood. Currently she is actively preparing to plant cotton, but lack of money has led her to request a loan. Qurbongul is a purposeful woman. In the future she would also like to raise livestock.

loans.use: to plant cotton

loans.name: Sonik

texts.en:
Sonik is from Lukashin village where she lives with her husband who is a driver. 

Sonik owns and cultivates a plot of land as well as keeping two calves. Her farm is small, but Sonik takes care of it with great love and pleasure, and the desire to make it big and profitable is strong. Thus, Sonik asks for this loan to be able to purchase 20 packages of fertilizer and cover cultivation costs. Sonik, with a good credit history behind her, asks lenders to support her farming business to help it develop.

loans.use: to pay for 20 packages of fertilizer and to cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Ayuba expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen Del Rosario forma parte del programa de comité de mujeres, donde las señoras se ayudan por salir adelante. Se reúnen mensualmente para brindarse apoyo en sus esfuerzos y de esa forma crecer.
Ellas son bastante solidarias entre sí, destacándose la Sra. Virginia, quien es modista,  ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que está luchando por sus seres queridos para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir con sus confecciones, como ser telas, hilos, gomas y demás, de manera a cumplir con sus clientes y con los pedidos de los mismos
texts.en:
The "Virgen Del Rosario" group is part of the program of women's committees, where women can help each other get ahead. They meet monthly to provide support to each other in their efforts and help each other grow. 

They have a strong sense of solidarity with each other, and this is especially true of Virginia, who is a clothing designer. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person, who is working hard for her loved ones, in order to give them everything that she was not able to have herself. 

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies so she can continue making her clothing, such as fabrics, thread, elastic and other items. In this way she will be able to satisfy her customers and complete their orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, elastic and other supplies to continue making custom clothing.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
“When women come together, they are powerful,” says Millicent, a 44-year-old farmer who has two children and lives in the village of Kutus in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. As a girl, she watched women in her village mobilize to replace traditional thatched roofs with waterproof corrugated iron. The memory of this collective effort led her to join Furaha self-help group. 

For the past year, Millicent has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere and women do the heavy work of fetching and carrying water and wood, in addition to household chores, childcare and tending crops. Many are left to run farms alone while their husbands migrate in search of paid employment. This has not been a setback because Millicent has been making great profits in farming. 

Kerugoya is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Millicent has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to start horticultural farming. 

Through the Furaha self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Millicent joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. 

This loan will improve Millicent's living conditions and secure the future of her children

loans.use: To start horticultural farming

loans.name: Orwa

texts.en: Orwa is a 22-year-old single man, one of 6 members in his family. He is a university student in his last year, majoring in Finance and Banking. Orwa is asking for a loan to pay for his semester fees, to be able to take the semester’s exams and graduate as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура, 42 года, замужем, мать 4 детей школьного возраста. У Айнуры - высшее образование, более 10 лет работает преподавателем в медицинском колледже.  Заработная плата у нее чуть больше 11,000 сом (KGS). Супруг более 20 лет работает заведующим отделением в городском родильном доме. Так как их дом нуждается в косметическом ремонте, Айнура решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), она приобретет обои, краску и обогреватели для дополнительного обогрева дома, так как есть маленькие дети. Сэкономленную заработную плату, Айнура будет вкладывать в образование ее детей.
texts.en: Ainura, 42 years old, married, and the mother of four school-age childen. Ainura has higher education. She has been working as a faculty member in a medical college for over 10 years. Her salary is slightly above 11,000 KGS. Her husband is the department chair in the local maternity clinic. Since their house needs to have renovations done, Ainura decided to apply to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy wallpaper, paint and heaters to improve the heating system in the family home as they have young children in the family. Ainura  will be saving money out of her salary in order to be able to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase heaters, as well as wallpapers, paints to make some improvements in her house

loans.name: La Perla Del Oriente Group

texts.es:
Jeniffer es una mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de un años y su negocio es la venta de desayuno y cena.
Ella es optimista, emprendedora, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Mutualista’, un lugar caracterizado por encontrarse ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, rodeado de oficinas y comercios, con una temperatura ambiente aproximada de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Jeniffer es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado , de complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el español y habla quechua por herencia familiar (sentada a la izquierda, con blusa celeste). Su vida la realiza con su pequeño hijo y vive en casa de sus padres; de ladrillo, con agua y electricidad. Pensando en el futuro de su pequeño hijo, buscó a personas con negocios como; venta de cubiertas de celulares, venta de coca a detalle, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras y venta de helado, para formar una banca de personas y solicitar un préstamo para mejorar sus actividades económicas(el grupo anteriormente estaba compuesto por otras personas). Su negocio es la venta de desayuno y cena. El desayuno consiste en un vaso de Api (maíz morado molido) acompañado con cuñapés (masa de harina con queso al horno) y la cena varía de acuerdo al inventario de la alacena que puede ser: masaco de yuca (yuca hervida con carne deshidratada con sal), masaco de plátano (plátano hervido con carne deshidratada con sal), Tamales a la olla (masa de choclo hervido con relleno de queso), Tamales al horno (masa de choclo con relleno de queso horneado), zonzos en pacumuto (yuca molida con queso a la parrilla), trabajo que realiza de lunes a viernes, el resto del tiempo se ocupa de su pequeño hijo. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en tres años que lleva con esta actividad. Su sueño es consolidarse en la zona y ser la preferida por los clientes. Ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor, debido a la dificultad que tiene de movilizarse con su bebé y de esa manera no le faltará materia prima para cocinar.
Es por esos motivos que Jeniffer solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor y no tener que movilizarse con su bebé para mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 21-year-old woman. She is single and has a 1-year-old son. Her business is selling breakfasts and dinners. She is optimistic, enterprising, responsible, hard-working, and a good mother. She operates her business in the ‘Mutualista’ zone, a place located in the center of the city, surrounded by offices and businesses. The temperature there is approximately 30 degrees Centigrade throughout the year. 

Jeniffer is of medium height, with brown skin and long braided black hair. She has a robust physical appearance. Her mother tongue is Spanish, but she also speaks Quechua because of her family heritage. (She is seated at the left, wearing a light blue shirt.) Together with her little child, she lives in her parents' house, which is made of brick, with water and electricity. Thinking about her young son's future, she looked for people with businesses such as selling cell phone cases, selling coca on a retail basis, selling quinoa juice, selling perfumes, selling soft drinks, selling traditional skirts, and selling ice cream, to form a communal bank and apply for a loan to improve their economic activities. (The group previously was made up of other people.) 

Her business is selling breakfasts and dinners. The breakfast consists of a glass of Api (ground purple corn), accompanied by cuñapés (baked corn flour with cheese). The dinner varies according to the inventory of her cupboard, and it may be: masaco de yuca (yuca boiled with dried meat and salt), masaco de plátano (plantains boiled with dried meat and salt), tamales a la olla (boiled corn dough with a cheese filling), tamales al horno (baked corn dough with a cheese filling), or zonzos en pacumuto (grilled ground yuca with cheese). 

She does this work from Monday through Friday, and the rest of the time she is occupied with her little son. This is the second loan sequence with the institution in the three years during which she has been doing this work. Her dream is to become established in the area and become the most preferred business among her customers. She wants to buy cooking supplies on a wholesale basis, due to the difficulty of transportation with her baby, to ensure that she does not run out of ingredients for cooking. 

For these reasons, Jeniffer is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies on a wholesale basis, so that she does not have to travel as often with her baby, for better safety.

loans.use: to buy ingredients wholesale so she doesn't have to travel as often with her baby, for better safety.

loans.name: Vilma Del Socorro

texts.es:
El humo que despega del asador, se logra identificar a larga distancia,  desde carne, pollo o cerdo, podrás encontrar en el negocio de Vilma, además de ser un negocio que le ha ayudado financieramente, ha podido cumplir sus metas que son seguir ofertando su comida, que ahora es muy conocida, y hasta de punto de referencia, donde las personas llegan a degustar la cuchara de Vilma. A través del primer crédito que se le facilito Vilma pudo fortalecer su negocio y esto le ayudo a obtener un incremento de sus ganancias, y también ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, brindándoles educación, mejorando su calidad de vida y de su familia para que puedan tener un futuro próspero.
Vilma agradece por el préstamo anterior que le fue de mucha ayuda y con ánimos de seguir prosperando, deposita su confianza en el crédito para la compra de productos tales como: pollo, carne, verduras entre otros y de esta manera incrementar sus ganancias y tener mayores oportunidades de rendimiento. Vilma siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer trabajadora, honesta, responsable, e innumerables valores que aprendió desde su niñez ahora quiere bríndale a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, con la facilitación del crédito podrá lograrlo, como planes a futuro Vilma espera mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
The smoke that comes off the grill can be smelled from a long distance. You can find beef, chicken, or pork at Vilma's business. In addition to being a business that has helped her financially, it has helped her achieve her goal of continuing to offer her food. The place where people arrive to taste Vilma's cooking is now very well-known, even as a point of reference.

With the first loan that she acquired, Vilma was able to strengthen her business, and this helped her obtain increased profits. In addition, she has been able to support her children's studies and to give them an education, improving her quality of life and that of her family so that they can have a prosperous future. Vilma is thankful for the previous loan, which was very helpful.

With hopes of continuing to thrive, Vilma is putting her faith on a loan to buy products such as chicken, beef, and vegetables, among other things, in order to increase her earnings and have greater opportunities to make profits. Vilma has always been described as a hard-working, honest, and responsible woman with many values that she has had since she was a child. Now, she wishes to give her family a better quality of life. She will be able to achieve this with the loan. In the future, Vilma hopes to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy products such as chicken, beef, and vegetables, among other things.

loans.name: Tomas Arquimides

texts.es:
Tomas de 41 años de edad,  estudio  hasta 8ª grado. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo quien le ayuda a trabajar en el taller, por lo que son 2 personas que dependen de él.
Tomas actualmente tiene un taller de estructura metálica y tiene 25 años de dedicarse a este oficio y lo aprendió desde niño con unos amigos. Ademas a trabajado en la agricultura lo aprendió desde niño por medio de sus padres; en el taller le ayuda su hijo y el horario es de 8 am a 8 pm todos los días, el taller lo tiene a 500 metros de su casa, luego por la tarde regresa a su casa a colaborar en el oficio de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un compresor, cables, ácido, aceites, etc para su taller .

Los sueños de Tomas son tener un taller fuerte, el cual le pueda quedar a su hijo, tener una vivienda digna para su familia , pero confiá en Dios y lo préstamo lo hara posible.
texts.en:
Tomas is 41 years old. He has an 8th grade education. His wife is a homemaker. He has a son who helps him work in the workshop, so that makes 2 people who depend on him.

Currently, Tomas has a metal workshop. He has been working in this trade for 25 years and he learned it as a kid with some friends. He has also worked in agriculture, which he learned from his parents as a child. His son helps him in the workshop and the schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day. The workshop is 500 meters from his house. In the evening he returns home to contribute to the housework.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of a compressor, cables, acid, oils, etc., for his workshop. Tomas' dream is to have a strong workshop that he can leave to his son and to have a worthy home for his family. He trusts in God and that He will make the loan possible.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, cables, acid, oil, etc., for his workshop.

loans.name: Feras

texts.en:
Feras is a 20-year-old single man. He is a university student, majoring in accounting in his second year. His father was retired but has now found another job as a machinery supervisor to continue supporting the family since his retirement salary will not be enough. 

Feras is requesting an education load to pay off his semester fees and will start looking for a job to pay the loan back and to save some pocket money.

loans.use: to pay off his semester fees.

loans.name: Rabi'u

texts.en: Rabi'u is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Rabi'u joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ashuru, Anas, and Sahalu.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Rabi'u would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Rabi'u can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Rabi'u spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children. He hopes to eventually become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his harvest fast at low prices.

loans.name: Thiago Group

texts.es:
GLADIS cariñosamente la llaman “Doña Chola” tiene 38 años y vive en un barrio muy vulnerable de San Lorenzo con una de sus 4 hijas y una nieta. Ella habita en una pequeña casa que le prestó una de sus amigas. GLADIS es quien se encarga de los gastos de la familia – GLADIS se dedica a la venta de pescado frito en la esquina de su casa desde hace 3 años.
Su pequeña nieta es su mayor felicidad. Y se esfuerza mucho para brindarle lo mejor. 
Es el primer crédito que realiza en toda su vida y dice haber tenido temor por la documentación que se exige normalmente.
Ella recibirá $ 500.00 con los que implementará la venta de lácteos y embutidos sin descuidar la venta de pescado frito.
En 5 años espera tener su propia casa con el negocio que tiene – logrando mejorar cada día. 
FODEMI viene a ser una ayuda muy importante ya que permite establecer nuevos retos a través de los negocios que benefician a la comunidad y a la niñez.
texts.en:
Gladis, affectionately known as “Doña Chola,” is 38 years old and lives in a very vulnerable neighborhood of San Lorenzo with one of her four daughters and a granddaughter. She lives in a small house which one of her friends lent to her. Gladis is the person responsible for the family's expenses. For three years, she has worked selling fried fish at the street corner by her house. 

Her little granddaughter is her greatest source of happiness. And she is putting forth great effort in order to provide her with the best. 

This is the first loan she has received in all of her life, and she says that she was afraid of all the documentation that is normally required. 

She will receive $500.00, which she will use to start selling dairy products and preserved meats, without neglecting her fried fish business. 

In five years, she hopes to have her own house thanks to her business -- getting a little bit better and better every day. 

FODEMI is coming to be a very important source of help, since it permits the establishment of new challenges for businesses that benefit the community and the children.

loans.use: to start selling dairy products and preserved meats, without neglecting her fried fish business.

loans.name: Alasan

texts.en: Alasan is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alasan joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ibrahim, Suleiman, and Sadiq. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alasan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alasan can now store his maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Alasan  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, hoping to eventually ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for urgent expenses such as school fees and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his harvest fast at low prices.

loans.name: Aliyu Bala

texts.en:
Aliyu Bala is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aliyu Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Aliyu Bala is looking  to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to eliminate pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara is a maize farmer from Maidawa village in Kaduna State. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hajara would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hajara can now store her maize at harvest time, and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Hajara, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand her farmland, and hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for immediate expenses such as expanding her farmland, thereby eliminating pressure to sell her harvest fast at low prices.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 31-year-old father of four children from Mundri County of South Sudan. James operates his own business. He buys and sells good items such as medicines, soap, candles, etc. 

James requested a loan from WOYE MFI so that he can expand his business. He will be able to increase his items. He hopes to build a clinic in the community and improve the living standards.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for the people

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kinogozi Glory Be To God Mixed Group

texts.en:
Ronald is a 33-year-old, married male living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a barber shop as his major business. He opened up a barber shop to earn a living, but when saw that little income was being earned, he decided to begin farming. He wants a loan to buy a generator.

He is a member of Kinogozi Glory Be To God Mixed Group, where members guarantee one another to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 46-year-old married male with 10 children. He stocks water for selling as his major business. He bought a maize mill machine for grinding maize to generate more income. Robert started the business to earn a living. He faces a challenge of competition and bad roads, which hinder his business.

loans.use: to buy more water for selling.

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard lives in Arevadasht village with her son, daughter-in-law and infant grand-daughter. 

Silvard runs a farm. She rents the land every year, and organizes the cultivation of different crops there. This year she cultivated wheat and pepper. 

To be able to enlarge the cultivation of wheat, she asks lenders to support her with the purchase of wheat seed (600 kg) and to cover cultivation costs. 

Silvard hopes to develop her farm and one day purchase her own plot of land.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seed and to cover cultivation costs.

loans.name: Habu Gabriel

texts.en:
Habu Gabriel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Habu Gabriel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ogustin, Obida and Lovina.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Habu Gabriel would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Habu Gabriel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Habu Gabriel spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to eliminate pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yakubu Philibus

texts.en:
Yakubu Philibus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yakubu Philibus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu Philibus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yakubu Philibus expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money  for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abdulahi

texts.en:
Abdulahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulahi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulahi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Abdulahi expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like school fees and food by eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca de  45 años de edad no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, porque sus padres no creían en el estudio esta acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura tienen 4 hijos que ya están casados, por lo que nadie dependen de ella.

Blanca toda su vida se a dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura y lo aprendió gracias a sus padres  y ella le tenia que ayudar a trabajar para ganarse la comida, ademas tiene una tienda en su casa que la atiende cuando regresa de trabajar, tiene que viajar 2 kilómetros en bicicleta para llegar a su parcela y le ayuda su compañero de vida ya los dos juntos se le hace mas fácil el trabajo, esto es de todos los días desde las 6 am hasta las 2 pm hora en que regresa a atender su tienda.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herbicidas y productos para la tienda. 

Los sueños de Blanca son poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que se superen, ademas de poder tener vacas lecheras para que se les haga mas fácil el trabajo.
texts.en:
Blanca is 45 years old; she didn't have the chance to study because her parents didn't believe in schooling. She has a live-in companion who works in farming. They have 4 children who are already married, so no one is dependent on her. 

All her life, Blanca has worked in farming and she learned it thanks to her parents. She had to help them work to earn her keep. She also has a store in her home that she tends when she returns from work. She has to travel 2 kilometers by bicycle to get to her plot of land. Her life companion helps her, and sticking together, the job doesn't seem so hard. This is their routine every day, from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. At that time, she returns to tend the store. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy seed corn, fertilizer, herbicides and products for the store. 

Blanca's dreams are to continue helping her children to better themselves, and to have milk cows so their work would be easier.

loans.use: To buy seed corn, fertilizer, herbicides and products for the store.

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de diciembre está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan para dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La Sra. Basilia que se dedica a la venta de queso y leche, es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella lucha día a día, poniendo su mejor esfuerzo en no dejarse vencer y dar a su familia todo y que no pasen por necesidades como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche y queso en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, y pueda seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group "8 De Diciembre" (8 Of December) is in cycle number 3 of the women committee program, in which they all work and help each other move forward. They are women who are heads of household that make an effort to give their families everything that they were not able to have.

Basilia makes a living selling cheese and milk. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial woman. She fights day after day, putting forth her best effort not to give up and to give her family everything so that they do not have to experience the need that she experienced.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy milk and cheese at wholesale so that, in this way, she can continue not only her sales, but also fulfilling the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese for sale.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
Desde las seis de la mañana y hasta las doce de la noche, cuando al fin se acuesta al, descansa de todo el arduo trabajo. No es fácil sacar a este hombre del trabajo. Francisco, no es corpulento, no tiene bigotes y calza botas. No usa gorra, sino sombrero, ni siquiera se espanta del buche de café caliente de las mañanas. Trabaja solo o con su hijo, su producción ha sido estable y tiende a aumentar, Francisco es un hombre que se ha dedicado a mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia, además de ser padre soltero le ha brindado a sus hijos, lo mejor que ha podido, expresa sentirse cómodo con el trato de MiCrédito, quienes siempre están trabajando por el bienestar de sus clientes. 
Francisco es un campesino con ingenio y una alborotada imaginación con la que va más allá de los caprichos de la naturaleza. Con la esperanza de desarrollar ese espacio tomado en provecho, solicita el crédito para la compra de los productos como, semillas de pipián, además del abono y los insumos para lograr una buena cosecha que le permitirá un mayor rendimiento en su producción, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento del crédito ya que este le ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias y de esa manera podrá seguir mejorando su hogar. Espera la sonrisa del futuro para perfeccionar su trabajo y así producir más. Hasta el momento su trabajo ha funcionado y recita sus declaraciones con el tono de un campesino orgulloso de lo que ha hecho.
texts.en:
From 6 in the morning until 12 at night after finally going to bed after an arduous day at work, it is not easy to get this man, Francisco away from his work. He is not big, he doesn't have a mustache and he does wear boots. He doesn't wear a cap but a hat. He is not afraid of a shot of hot coffee in the morning.

He works alone or with his son. His production has been stable and tends to increase. Francisco is a man who is dedicated to improving the economic stability of his family. Besides being a single father he has tried to provide for his children as best he can. He states that he is happy with his treatment with MiCredito who have always worked for the benefit of their clients.

Francisco is a farmer with wits and an unruly imagination which go up and beyond the whims of nature. With the hopes of developing this space to advantage he is requesting a loan to buy products like squash seeds as well as fertilizer and supplies to achieve a good harvest which will increase his production. He is putting his faith in the loan as it will help him increase his profits and in this way he can make improvements on his house. He hopes that the future smiles on him and perfects his work and make him produce more. For the moment his work has been going well and he tells his story in the tone of a farmer proud of what he has done.

loans.use: to buy cushaw squash seeds as well as fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Yusifa

texts.en:
Yusifa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusifa would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusifa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Yusifa expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to eliminate pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en: Bala is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Bala is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses like food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zakariah

texts.en:
Zakariah is a maize farmer from Gedege village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zakariah would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zakariah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Zakariah, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like food and clothing by eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Le'atu Indo

texts.en:
Le'atu Indo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Le'atu Indo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Yakubu, Aminu and Micah.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Le'atu Indo would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Le'atu Indo can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Le'atu Indo spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to make more money for herself and her family.

loans.use: to access a loan that meets expenses like school fees and food by eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single young man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a small house in the city. His father has a supermarket in the city. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mohammed is a student in a local university where he is studying to be a legal secretary. He would like to complete his study and find a job to support his family.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. This will help him to do his homework and write reports easily. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Hannatu Dige

texts.en:
Hannatu Dige is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hannatu Dige joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Ashiru, Sule and Lsuwa.

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hannatu Dige would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hannatu Dige can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Hannatu Dige spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children. She hopes eventually to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like her children's school fees and food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
LUZ  mujer trabajadora de 44 años que vive con sus 5 hijos en la frontera con Colombia. Es madre soltera y la casa en la que habita es propia.
LUZ se dedica a la extracción de conchas en el manglar y a la compra venta de este producto.
Sus hijos van normalmente a la escuela.
Con el primer crédito ella compró la concha de sus compañeros para luego venderla a los intermediarios. Le ha dado muy buenos resultados y con este nuevo crédito, continuará con esta actividad. Ya que de esta forma puede permanecer más tiempo en su casa y estar al cuidado de sus hijos que están creciendo.
Sus aspiraciones son de poder comprar mucha más concha- implementar una nueva actividad comercial para ampliar su negocio – apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Agradece a FODEMI por lo que no solicita demasiados requisitos para poder trabajar mediante el apoyo de un crédito.
texts.en:
Luz is a 44-year-old hardworking woman. She lives near the Colombian border with her 5 children. She is a single mother and owns the house she lives in. Luz makes a living extracting shellfish from the mangrove and buying and selling this product. Her children go to school.

With her first loan, Luz bought shellfish from her partners to then sell to wholesale buyers. She has gotten good results, so with this new loan, she will continue with this activity. That way, she can spend more time at home and take care of her children who are growing up.

Luz's aspirations are to be able to buy a lot more shellfish, to implement a new commercial activity to expand her business, and to support her children with their education. She is grateful to Fodemi for not requesting overbearing requirements in order to get a loan from them.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of shellfish to sell to wholesale buyers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Musa Yohana

texts.en:
Musa Yohana is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Musa Yohana would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa Yohana can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Like other Babban Gona members, Musa Yohana is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family. He hopes to ensure that his children, Daneal, Dauda and Emmanuel, are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to meet expenses like his children's school fees and food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plasticware

loans.name: Francisco Humberto

texts.es:
Francisco de 62 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos de 39, 34 y 33 años de edad, todos independientes y con hogar aparte. Estudió hasta bachillerato, su esposa le apoya en su negocio, solo ella vive con él.

Francisco es comerciante, desde hace 15 años tiene un puesto ambulante en el que vende panes con pollo y refresco de diferentes variedades, su esposa lo apoya en la actividad y es así como se han ganado la vida. Su horario de trabajo es de 9:00 am a 1:00 pm de lunes a viernes.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar los ingredientes que necesita para elaborar sus panes, pollo, pan francés, repollo, aderezos, refrescos y para complementar el pago de un vehículo que le servirá para movilizarse con su negocio. Francisco espera comprar el vehículo porque además le servirá para salir de paseo como familia.
texts.en:
Francisco, 62, is married and has 3 children, 39, 34 and 33 years old. They are all independent and with separate homes. He studied until high school, his wife supports him in his business, only she lives with him.

Francisco is a merchant, for the past 15 years he's had a moving space where he sells bread with chicken and soda of different types. His wife supports him in the activity, this is how they've earned their living. His work schedule is from 9:00 am to 1:00 pm, Monday to Friday.

The loan will be used to buy the ingredients that he needs to make his breads: chicken, french bread, cabbage, dressings, soda and to supplement the payment of a vehicle which will serve him to mobilize his business. Francisco hopes to buy the vehicle because, additionally, it will serve him to take his family out.

loans.use: to buy chicken, french bread, cabbage, dressings, soda and to supplement the payment of a vehicle.

loans.name: Emmanuel

Emmanuel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Emmanuel expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses like child school fees and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.fr:
Mme LEONIE est la responsable du groupe RENAISSANCE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. 
Mme veut s’acheter 10 sacs de mil, 10 sacs d'haricot.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne  agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. LEONIE is the official of the group RENAISSANCE. She is in good health. A married woman, she is the mother of three children. The oldest is 19 years old, and the youngest is 9. Three go to school. 

Ms. LEONIE has been selling grains for eleven years. She gets her supplies from nearby village. She wants to purchase 10 sacks of millet and 10 sacks of beans. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of millet and 10 sacks of beans

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BEDEYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 2 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à OUAYERMA II un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dix-neuvième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame ALIMA fait la vente de condiment dans ce groupe de femmes BADEYA. Elle est debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  11 paquets de cube Maggi,  4 sacs de laye plus divers condiments  pour la revente au détail au marché à une clientèle composée de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 14 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group BEDEYA are marred women, who average 39 years of age and two children each living for the most part in traditional families in  OUAYERMA II, a working-class district in Sikasso City (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are on their 19th solidarity with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. 

Ms. ALIMA sells condiments in this women’s group BADEYA. She is the one standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase 11 packets of Maggi cubes [bouillon cubes], 4 sacks of garlic, and more of various other condiments to resell to a customer base composed of women paying with cash or credit.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 14,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used to pay back the loan with interest, as well as to put money toward her savings.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Blanca Jenniffer

texts.es:
Blanca de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta 7ª grado, esta acompañada y su pareja  se dedica a pescar, tienen 3 hijos que están estudiando y viven con ella por lo que son 3 personas que dependen de ella.

Blanca actualmente se dedica hacer tortillas para vender, oficio que aprendió desde niña junto a su madre, ademas tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa. Antes de eso trabajo 8 años como empleada domestica.  Se  levanta todos los días a las 5 am a cocer el maíz para las tortillas y hacer el desayuno para su familia, por la tarde termina a las 6 pm o hasta que dejan de llegar a comprar tortillas.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar harina, detergentes, huevos, azúcar, golosinas, bebidas, entre otro productos para su tienda.  

Los sueños de Blanca son ver crecer a sus hijos, darles el estudio necesario para que tengan un buen trabajo y tener mas fuerte su tienda.
texts.en:
Blanca is 28 years old. She stayed in education until 7th grade. She is in a relationship and her partner is a fisherman. They have 3 children who are in education and live with her, meaning she has 3 people depending on her. 

Blanca currently makes and sells tortillas, a skill which she learnt as a child from her mother. She also runs a shop from her house in which she sells basic commodities. Prior to this she worked as a housekeeper for 8 years. She gets up every day at 5am to boil the corn for the tortillas and make breakfast for her family. She stops working at 6pm, or when customers stop coming to buy tortillas. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy flour, detergents, eggs, sugar, sweets, drinks and other products for her shop. 

Blanca's dreams are to watch her children grow up, to give them the education they need to get good jobs, and to improve her shop.

loans.use: to buy flour, detergents, eggs, sugar, sweets, drinks etc. for her shop

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en: Isiya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Isiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Isiya expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home and, in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to meet expenses like clothing and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses such as child school fees and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas 2 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que tiene las esperanzas puestas en que a través de este programa y del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, irán mejorando sus condiciones de vida, y superando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma , quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir que esta en un nivel medio, esforzándose por mejorar su situación de pobreza. Ella tiene como deseo poder emprender en la venta de mercería, es por eso que pide este préstamo.
La Sra. Zulma desea comprar artículos de bazar, prendas, calzados, y demás, de  manera a poder emprender este negocio en el cual ella ve muchas esperanzas que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas 2 group is in its first cycle of the women's committee program. It is a new group that has its hopes pinned on improving living conditions and getting out of poverty, through this program and the poverty elimination program. 

One of the members is Zulma. On her last survey, she demonstrated a poverty level in the 2 range; that is, in the mid-range, struggling to improve her situation. 

Her wish is to get started in the sale of notions and sundries, and that is why she is requesting this loan. Zulma wants to buy variety store items, accessories, footwear, etc., so she can launch this business, which she is hopeful will help her out a great deal.

loans.use: To buy variety store items, accessories, footwear, etc.

loans.name: Mshikamano  Group

texts.en:
Tambala is a father who is 38 years old, married and has three sons and one daughter who are at school. He runs a motorcycle service; he transports passengers to different places around the town. He has been in this transportation business for five years. He works from  6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily. Tambala is able to realize a small profit. He dreams to grow his income more by managing several motorcycles. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his fifth credit request to be apportioned among Mshikamano, a three-member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous four credits to maintain his motorcycle, bought new tires, paid for fuel and changed oil every week. He recommends that, by doing so, a motorbike can stay longer without problems; hence, see its benefits. Tambala received an extra income, which he used to pay school fees and buy food for his family. In the coming years, Tambala would like to manage several motorbikes.

He will invest a portion of his loan to cover maintenance expenses and will add to his amount he generated to buy a new bike.

loans.use: to cover maintenance expenses and add to his amount he generated to buy a new bike.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.en:
Gabino and his family live on a small farm in Mexico and dedicate themselves to raising and selling cows. Gabino also grows corn, part of which he sells in the local market, and kidney beans for his family's own consumption.
