He is very enthusiastic about investing in a biodigester, since it will give him the opportunity to take advantage of his cows' manure to produce biogas and biofertilizer, thus generating significant savings and allowing him to become much more self-sufficient. 

His family used to walk for several hours to collect wood in the mountains in order to cook, and the smoke in the kitchen was damaging the women's health. The LP gas they needed to heat water is also very expensive, as are the chemical fertilizers Gabino bought for his field. He will now be able to replace all these polluting and unhealthy energy sources and fertilizers with renewable energy and the nutrient-rich natural fertilizer produced from his animals' waste. His farm will become a more comfortable place to live; since the piles of waste will be put into the biodigester, bad smells and flies will disappear and watersheds will not be contaminated anymore. 

This loan represents 16% of the total cost of the biodigester; the remaining amount is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a six-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdul would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to provide for his immediate cash needs. 

Abdul is requesting a loan to meet his current expenses such clothing and food which will thereby eliminate pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest. With his loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdul can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Abdul expressed a desire to use the extra income from his loan to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to meet expenses and eliminate pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a six-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Adamu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Adamu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Adamu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure that his children, Shamsiya, Sani and Aisha are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses like child school fees and food, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Aminu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Aminu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Aminu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access a loan that meets expenses such as child school fees and food, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en: Jesus is a very hardworking and responsible person who is interested in seeking the best for his family through his business of buying and selling clothes. He has several years of experience in the business and is looking for the opportunity to use this loan to improve his business by buying winter clothes and new clothing options in a lower-price season. He says earnings that are handled correctly can help your family to have a better situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock of new clothes

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
Aniceta is a businesswoman who operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She is 62 year old. She sells goods like bread, noodles, biscuits, chips, cooking oil, canned goods and soft drinks. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years now. Together with her husband, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

Aniceta has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase more stock, like rice, coffee, toiletries, chocolates, soft drinks and seasonings. She would like to expand her variety store business to have a stable income that will help them achieve a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, like rice, coffee, toiletries, chocolates, soft drinks and seasonings

loans.name: Mikah

texts.en:
Mikah is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to provide for his immediate cash needs. 

Mikah is requesting a loan to meet his current expenses such as clothing and food. His loan will thereby eliminate pressure to sell his corn for low prices as harvest. With his loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mikah can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Mikah expressed a desire to use the extra income from his loan to build a better home, and in the long run, become the most  profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy clothing and food to eliminate the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en:
Abdullahi is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to provide for his immediate cash needs. 

Abdullahi is requesting a loan to meet his current expenses such as clothing and food. His loan will thereby eliminate pressure to sell his corn for low prices as harvest. With his loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdullahi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Abdullahi expressed a desire to use the extra income from his loan to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure that his children Buhari, Muktar and Safaria are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy clothing and food to eliminate the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Antonio; está en su ciclo número  12 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo bastante numeroso, formado de amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Itá.
Cada una de estas mujeres están luchando por sus familias, para poder darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Mirna, la presidenta de este grupo se esfuerza para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida. Ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma prepara y que luego sale a vender de forma ambulante. Comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que sus productos son muy ricos, y sus clientes siempre le hacen muchos pedidos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, de manera cumplir con sus clientes,  seguir haciendo las delicias que vende.
texts.en:
The group called "San Antonio" is in its 12th loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is quite a numerous group, formed by friends and neighbors in the city of Itá.

Each one of these women is working hard for her family, to be able to give them everything that she was not able to have. Mima, the president of this group, is making an effort to be able to grow and be someone in life. She sells food that she herself prepares and that she then goes out to sell as a street vendor. She comments that she has established a very good clientele, since her products are very delicious, and her customers always place a lot of orders. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy ingredients to make her foods, such as vegetables, condiments, greens, and other items, so that she can meet her clients' demands and continue making the delicacies that she sells.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, greens, and other items to make food to sell.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is a 63-year-old married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She has eleven grown children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store and sells goods like eggs, noodles, powdered milk, soy sauce, soap, biscuits and canned goods. She has been operating a variety store for more than 10 years now.
 
Aurora has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy assorted goods like noodles, seasonings, soft drinks, chips and canned goods. This additional stock would be a big help to attract more customers and probably increase sales.

Aurora would like to expand her business to improve the family's standard of living and to set aside some savings to prepare for old age.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods like noodles, seasonings, soft drinks, chips and canned goods

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of four adult children, and she is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She earns an income through her retail business, selling crude oil. Crude oil is used to run a fishing boat.
 
Nelly has been in the business for more than three years now. Her husband earns additional income through his fishing business.

Nelly would like to borrow a loan to buy crude oil. With this loan, she will be able to add to her inventory, thus allowing her to sell more crude oil to fisherman for their boats. 

Nelly has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy crude oil.

loans.name: Tupendane C Group

texts.en:
Halima was born in 1979. She is married and has got two kids who are at school. Halima is a hardworking mother who runs small enterprises with the goal of being successful. For the past three years, Halima has run a café, or a mamalishe, where she serves breakfast and lunch, and she also manages a clothing business. She works from six in the morning and seven at night and is able to make a good return. Halima will share her loan with her loan group, Tupendane C, which consists of four members who will all hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Halima is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her mamalishe. This will be her second loan from the Kiva Tujijenge Tanzania. Halima repaid her previous loan successfully and she used the funds to buy mamalishe food items and clothes to resell. She used the profit from her loan to cover household expenses. In the future, Halima hopes to open a general store.

loans.use: to buy food cooking items for her mamalishe

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is fifty-five years old, married and has seven children; three are in school and four are grown. She supports her family by running a business selling soft drinks, sodas, water, and packed juices, a business she has been in for fifteen years now. She runs her business from 9 am to 10 pm each working day and is able to make a very good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is Christina's eighth credit which she intends to use to improve her business. She will buy stock of soft drinks for her shop. She managed her previous credits well, buying more drinks for her shop. Christina earned an extra income, which she used to buy house cupboards and to cover school fees and home food expenses. She is so happy now with her business because it has improved and gives her nice returns. 

In the coming years, she would like to build a house and be successful. Christina will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of soft drinks for her shop

loans.name: Nakeisha

texts.en:
Nakeisha started Swift 'N' Shine, a janitorial service business, in 2003. It is based out of Dorchester, Mass., and provides cleaning and repair services to individuals and retail establishments. Currently Nakeisha works with a handful of contractors, including her father. Her business supports herself and her teenage daughter. Having been in business for over ten years, Nakeisha still finds her business engaging: “In my field, there is always a lot to learn and I enjoy teaching myself.” And she knows how important it is to maintain momentum, saying: “When you are self-employed you only get paid when you work. So it is important to stay proactive.”

Nakeisha needs a loan to buy cleaning supplies. These additional supplies will allow Swift 'N' Shine to continue to take on jobs, both large and small, and keep the Boston area clean!

loans.use: to purchase cleaning supplies for her janitorial service business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 70-year-old man. He is married to Jacinta, who adds additional income to their family, and is blessed with seven children. Charles has been operating a rental business as a landlord for a period of five years, earning himself an income of KES 5,000 at the end of every month.

Charles is servicing his fourth loan of KES 90,000 with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use this amount to buy windows, metal doors, cement, and wall paint to finish building his rental house.

Charles plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy windows, metal doors, cement, and wall paint.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 41-year-old married woman with seven children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Annabelle has a business buying and selling native mats in the Philippines. she requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her native mat business.

Annabelle has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native mat business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. For the last 14 years, she has been cooking and selling tacos. Maria Elena has many recurring clients and enjoys her work. Her biggest accomplishment is earning her own money and being able to save a little bit.

Maria Elena is requesting a loan to buy some equipment to be able to cook faster and in larger quantities. Her goal is to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking equipment for her food stall

loans.name: Desiree

texts.en:
Desiree is 31 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Desiree is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Desiree has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Desiree would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: José Amilcar

texts.es:
José de 40 años de edad, es muy trabajador y es bien responsable, es padre de dos hijos los cuales no viven con él, pero José siempre esta pendiente de la alimentación, vestuario y salud.

Actualmente José trabaja como vigilante municipal y en sus días libres atiende un pequeño negocio que tiene en su casa.

El dinero lo necesita para hacer unas reparaciones a su vivienda, comprara lamina, madera, abobe,  aprovechando que ya esta en verano y es mas fácil hacer construcciones.

En estos momentos José  solo quiere tener su casa bien bonita y conservar su trabajo.
texts.en:
José, who is 40 years old, is very hard-working and responsible. He is the father of two children who don't live with him, but he always watches out for their food, clothing, and health.

José now works as a municipal watchman, and on his free days he tends to a small business that he has in his house.

He needs the money to make some repairs on his house. He will buy metal sheeting, wood, and adobe, taking advantage of the fact that it is summer and it is easier to do construction.

At this time, José only wants to have his house be really nice and keep his job.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and adobe to make some repairs on his house, taking advantage of the fact that it is summer, and it is easier to do construction.

loans.name: Kimheng's Group

texts.en: A local resident from Kampong Speu province, Kimheng is 30 years old and a father of two children. To support his family and improve his family's condition, he earns an income via rice cropping and extra income through raising chickens. He can earn about 15,000 KHR per day. For Kimheng, this is his first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, he leads a group of four to get a new loan. As a group leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. He hopes that he can update his family's living condition and health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Ena Elixenda

texts.es:
Ena de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta el bachillerato, está acompañada  y son personas muy trabajadoras, dependen de familias muy unidas, y luchadoras.

 Ella se dedica a trabajos del hogar, vive con la mamá pues  la señora esta mayor y su compañero de vida se dedica a jalar materiales con un camión, (piedra, arena, bloque, etc.) 

Ella solo sabe tejer petates, pues es un trabajo que se da mucho en la zona, también la mamá vende algunos productos de tienda y ella le ayuda a la atención de los clientes. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para cambiarle la cama al camión con el que trabaja el esposo, pues la tiene bastante deteriorada y cuando jala materiales como arena, grava, o tierra, se le cae un poco, motivo por el cual algunas personas no lo buscan para que les jale los materiales.

 Con el crédito mejorara su vehículo y obtenga más clientes para poder trabajar y obtener mejores ingresos, ella al igual que toda madre sueña con que sus hijos se han profesionales y tener condiciones económicas para alimentación, vivienda, y estudio, lo cual será señal de superación para la familia.
texts.en:
Ena is 31 years old, she studied up until high school. She lives with someone and they are both hard-working people, they come from very tight-knit, determined families. 

She is a homemaker and lives with her mother because she's elderly. Her life companion works transporting materials with a truck (stone, sand, cement blocks, etc.)

All she knows how to do is weave sleeping mats, which is a job that is very common in the region. Also, her mother sells some store items, and Ena helps her wait on the customers. 

The loan she is requesting is to replace the bed on her husband's work truck, because it is badly deteriorated and when he transports materials like sand, gravel or dirt, some of it falls out, so some people don't seek him out to transport their materials. 

With the loan, he will upgrade his vehicle and obtain more customers so he can work and make more income. She, like all mothers, dreams of her children having a career and the economic conditions for food, housing and schooling, which would be a sign that her family is getting ahead.

loans.use: To replace the bed on her husband's work truck, because it is badly deteriorated and when he transports loads of sand, gravel or dirt, some of it falls out.

loans.name: Phillip

texts.en:
Stylish men in Florida know where to go for the best in men’s neckwear, pocket squares, and cufflinks: Styles By Kutty! Phillip started Styles by Kutty in 2008, when he realized he was the go-to gent for his friends and family when it came to neckties and such. Phillip knows that there is no point in being stylish if it costs the customer an arm and a leg: his website says, “SBK is committed to keeping men on the cutting edge of fashion by offering men’s accessories that can be characterized as fashionably elegant, yet affordable.” SBK has an active presence on Facebook, highlighting new products as well as recent customer interactions.

As a small business, Phillip would like to take every opportunity to get the word out about his product. His loan will help him purchase exhibition equipment, additional inventory, and rev up his online marketing efforts.

Check out his website at: http://stylesbykutty.com/

loans.use: to purchase exhibition equipment, additional inventory, and online marketing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover some expenses for his daughters who are studying in university.

loans.name: José Atilio

texts.es: El préstamo será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena, piedra, ladrillos y tejas para construir una habitación. José se proyecta que con el tiempo pueda construir una habitación para cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en: This loan will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, bricks, and tiles to construct a room. José projects that with time he will be able to build a room for each one of his children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, stone, bricks, and tiles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy equipment to make the internet cafe laptops up to date.

loans.name: Perlina

texts.en:
Perlina is from Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. She and her partner have three school-age kids. In order to survive, they are engaged in selling fish in different barangays (villages) in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. They use only their motorcycle, with her husband as the driver, to reach the different villages and sell fish. She has run her business for two years now and it is doing well. 

In 2010, she joined PMPC. She appreciates its programs and services. In need of additional working capital, she has requested financial assistance from PMPC in the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase more stock of fish. Through this, she hopes to increase her income to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is happy that she can support the education of her children, which is her main priority despite her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for reselling

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
José de 25 años de edad, se acompañó y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, estudió hasta 9° grado de educación básica su esposa es empleada, trabaja para una compañía telefónica, viven en una casa familiar pero solo su hijo depende de él.

José desde que dejo de estudiar busco trabajo, su padre siempre le marco el afán de trabajar, es empleado de la alcaldía de su comunidad. El préstamo será utilizado para pagar los gastos de su boda, pago de abogado y demás. José espera seguir trabajando para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old. He is married and has a three-year-old son. He went to school through the 9th grade of basic education. His wife is employed. She works for a telephone company. They live in a family house, but only his son depends on him.

José has looked for work since he left school. His father always records his willingness to work; he is an employee of the city hall in his community. The loan will be used to pay the costs of his wedding, pay for the lawyer, and other costs. José hopes to continue working to cover the needs of his family.

loans.use: to pay the costs of his wedding, pay the lawyer, and other expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's operation.

loans.name: Las Campeonas Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Las Campeonas este grupo está en el 2do. ciclo con ganas de seguir trabajando. El grupo tiene 17 integrantes, todas con muy buenas expectativas sobre las actividades que realizamos con ellas. Son de la ciudad de Santaní, una ciudad eminentemente rural.
Una de las integrantes la Sra. Herenia quien se dedica a la venta de chipa es una señora muy emprendedora y trabajadoras,  la chipa es un alimento típico paraguayo que se consumo en cualquier estación del año. Herenia comenta que le va muy bien y que tiene ya muy buena clientela.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de chipas, de manera a poder invertirlo en su emprendimiento, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The group is called Las Campeonas, which is in its second loan cycle with hopes of continuing to work. The group has 17 members, all who have high expectations of the activities they complete. They are from the city of Santaní, a very rural city.

One of the members is Herenia, who makes a living selling cheesy buns. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman. Cheesy buns are typical Paraguayan food, and they are eaten all year around. Herenia says that it's going very well and she has a very good customer base.

She is requesting this loan to invest in buying cheesy buns so she can invest in her business and so she can continue working on improving.

loans.use: to buy cheesy buns wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 49 years old and married with nine children.

Emelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Emelita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Savan's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Prey Veng province, Savan is 41 years old and a mother of four children. Nowadays, she can earn income to support her family via rice farming. She has been involved this business for ages and it earns her about 44,400 KHR per day. This is her first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy piglets and pig feed to support her new business. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living better than before.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed to support her new business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 49 years old, married and has three children. Juditha is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Juditha has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Juditha has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Juditha would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Angelita is 39 years old and has seven children who are in school.

Angelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Angelita has requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other materials to use in her business. Angelita has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Luchadoras está en su ciclo 10 del programa de comité de mujeres emprendedoras, donde todas mantienen una actividad propia emprendida por ellas mismas, trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
 Son mujeres emprendedoras donde la mayoría tienen su actividades particulares, se destaca entre ellas la Sra. Inocencia, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida y con la que surte a su barrio entero. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, comenta que su día empieza desde muy temprano, ya que tiene que atender a sus clientes, su sueño es poder seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento para poder continuar ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos varios para la venta en su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, bebidas, productos a granel y demás, de manera a seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The committee named “Luchadoras” (The Tenacious Ones) is in its 10th loan cycle with the Committee Program of Women Entrepreneurs. All of the members have maintained businesses that they have started themselves. They work and help one another in order to get ahead.

The members are enterprising women and most of them have private businesses. One of these women who is worth noting is Sra. Inocencia. She has a well-stocked food pantry and sells to the entire neighborhood. Inocencia is a hardworking and enterprising individual. She says that she begins her day very early so that she can attend to her customers. Her dream is to keep growing in her enterprise so that she can continue helping her family.

Inocencia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in various products that she can sell at her food pantry such vegetables, fruits, meat, beverages, bulk goods, and other items so that she can continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, beverages, bulk goods, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Tape Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Tape Pyahu” es un comité de  mujeres que son muy bien organizadas, trabajadoras y solidarias unas con otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad de Villarrica, y todas son vecinas. Se reúnen para brindarse apoyo y ayuda unas a otras en su esfuerzos a desarrollar su situación económica.
Gilvana es miembro de este grupo, ella es peluquera y comenta que le va muy bien en su trabajo ya que tiene muchos clientes que siempre la prefieren por su buen servicio y trabajo y a bajo costo, es muy conocida ya en el barrio. Ella quiere seguir con su trabajo y quiere poder dar a las demás personas fuentes de trabajo para que al igual que ella puedan salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprare insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y demás, lo que le será de mucha ayuda para poder continuar.
texts.en:
The Tape Pyahu group is a women's committee who are well organized, hardworking and supportive of each other. These women are from the city of Villarrica, and they are all neighbors. They get together to offer support and help one another in their efforts and to develop their financial situations.

Gilvana is a member of this group, she is a hair stylist and says that she is doing very well in her work as she has a lot of clients who always come to her for her good service, work and the low cost, she is very well-known in the neighborhood. She wants to continue her work and wants to be able to give other people sources of work so that they can get ahead, just like her.

She is requesting a loan to be able to buy supplies for her hair salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, etc. which will be a great help for her to continue.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, etc.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 68 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines. She is married with eight children. She has run a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living for five years. She has requested a loan to buy additional stock, such as rice, soap and oil to sell in her sari-sari store. 

Pacita has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional stock, such as rice, soap and oil for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work tools, a wood plane and a drill

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en: Sokhorn is 34 years old and a mother of four children living in Kampong Speu province. For her living, she earns income to support her family via rice cropping. She can earn about 22,000 KHR per day. For Sokhorn, this is her sixth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. Therefore, she is applying for a new loan in order to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will have a decent latrine to use.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Khny's Group

texts.en: A resident who lives in Kampong Speu Province, Khny is 41 years old and a mother of two children who attend school. To support her living conditions, Khny earns an income via rice cropping. She has been involved this business for a long time and it earns her about 22,000 KHR per day. For Khny, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water for using.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Miria Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MIRIA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires  dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  savons à l’image de KADIATOU qui est la 1ère femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 7 cartons de savon avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Miria group is comprised of five married women. On average, they are 35 years old and have 5 children. They live in nuclear families in the Heremakono Nord neighborhood of the city of Bougouni. 

They know one another through neighbors, friends, and business. In order to bolster their finances and in order to improve their business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first loan with the institution. 

This women’s group sells soaps through Kadiatou, the woman seated at right. With her loan, she would like to buy 7 boxes of soap from the Bougouni wholesalers. She sells in the market and out of her home. She sells at retail prices for cash and credit to a mixed clientele. 

She would like to earn an average monthly income of 12,500 FCFA, which she'll use to invest in the business and pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy soap.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is a 31-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elene has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to offer for sale.

Elene has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Speu Province, Mom is 26 years old and a mother of one child. To improve her family's conditions, she grows rice as her single source of her income. She has been involved in this business for years. She can earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

For Mom, this is her first time with VisionFund Cambodia, Kiva’s partner. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She wants her family to have a decent latrine to use.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 36 years old, lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City with her husband and three children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to earn income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand and snacks to their neighbors. 

She joined PMPC, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small variety) store in November 2009. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she has applied for a 25,000 PHP loan to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and restock inventories of nets and different types of fishing accessories to sell. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery and general merchandise store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and restock inventories of nets and fishing accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 48 years old and lives in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents. Imelda has been engaged in the business of selling bananas for 10 years already. Her family is also supported by her brother. She earns approximately PHP4,000 each month from doing this type of work and this amount is so helpful to meet her family's needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of banana. Imelda only became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Imelda hopes to expand her banana vending business and to have her own family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas.

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
Rabina is 42 years old and married with eight children. With seven children in school, Rabina works very hard to provide for them.

Rabina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, and shampoo. Rabina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Rabina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like beverages, canned goods, and shampoo

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is 46 years old and has four children. She is a married woman and all of her children are in school.

Silveria is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Silveria has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Silveria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Leonila works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Leonila has requested PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 63 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to support her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages,etc..

Teofila has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Teofila would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages,etc.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with ten children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and is 45 years old.

Teresa has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Teresa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, de 10 y 7 años de edad y uno de 3 días de nacido, solo dos estudian. Su esposa es comerciante y se encarga de un pequeño negocio que ambos tienen. Solo ella u sus hijo viven con él.

José es empleado, trabaja prestando servicios de seguridad privada en un súper mercado, tiene más de 8 años trabajando de esta manera, tiene un salario bien bajo es por eso que tomo la iniciativa de poner su tienda con la que le apoya su esposa.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, aceite, productos de higiene personal y de cocina, entre otros para abastecer su tienda. Siempre soñó con una tienda una tienda fuerte que tenga cada uno de los productos que sus clientes buscan.
texts.en:
José, 36 years old, is married and has three children ages 10, 7, and 3 days old. Two of them are in school. His wife is a vendor and is in charge of a small store they both own. Just his wife and their children live with him.

José has a job, working by providing security services to a supermarket. He has done this work for eight years. His salary is low, which is why he took the initiative to open a store, where his wife also helps.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, sugar, oil, personal hygiene products, cooking products, and other items to stock up his store. He always dreamed of a strong store that would have all the products his customers needed.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, oil, personal hygiene products, cooking products, and other items to stock up his store.

loans.name: Jocylyn

texts.en:
In 2013, Jocylyn learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Jocylyn tried her luck with doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to PMPC for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Jocylyn borrowed another amount to pay for labor to spray insecticide on her mango trees to protect them from damage. This will give her farming income a big boost. Jocylyn looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for insecticide for her mango plantation

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a 39-year-old married woman with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Riza has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Riza has requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other materials to use in her business. Riza has been in this business for three years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas lives in Dili. She is married and has four children. She has a shop in the center of the market, so many people come to buy from it. Domingas has been involved in business activities since 2006. She started with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income from selling shoes, and is still happy to do her business. She sells shoes, bags and other things. 

She is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to add more inventory, including shoes, bags and other things to sell.

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags and other things to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara Karina

texts.es:
Xiomara de 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia kínder en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo es agricultor y ocasionalmente trabaja como albañil. Xiomara estudió hasta 8° grado de educación básica, dejo la escuela porque vivía con su madre y hermanos y esta ya no podía darle el estudio.

Xiomara es comerciante, tiene 3 años de trabajar en  un negocio en el que venden tortillas, las venden de manera ambulante y por encargos, también es empleada doméstica en la casa de la señora donde elaboran las tortillas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz y para otros gastos que tiene con su hijo que se graduará del kínder. Xiomara sueña con tener su propia casa donde vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 31 years old. She is married and has a 7-year-old son who is in kindergarten at the local community school. Her husband is a farmer, and he occasionally works as a bricklayer. Xiomara studied a basic education through 8th grade. She left school because she lived with her mother and her siblings, and her mother could not afford her education.

Xiomara makes a living as a merchant. For the past 3 years, she has worked for a business that sells tortillas. They sell them as street vendors and also by request. In addition, she works as a housemaid in the house of the woman where they make the tortillas. 

She will use this loan to buy corn and to cover the expenses of her son who will graduate from kindergarten. Xiomara dreams of having her own house, where she can live with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and to cover the expenses of her son who will graduate from kindergarten.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene, 26 years old, is married with one child. She has been selling fish in her village to make a living. She owns and manages a fish pond and sells fish in the market. She borrowed a loan to buy new fishing nets to improve her fishing business. She was able to help and support her parents' needs with her business. She is hopeful to earn more income to build a house and to have a comfortable and safe place to live with her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets in order to improve the business.

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu Province, Chanthorn is 47 years old and a mother of four children. To support her family, she can earn income via rice cropping. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn additional income. For Chanthorn, this is her seventh loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In a group of seven, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions and their health.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn has been running a small grocery store in her village so as to provide for the needs of her two children. While her husband helps her with the store, he’s often out working on their farm.

To improve sales, Arlyn took out a 10,000 PHP loan through GDMPC to buy more goods to resell. She continues to work hard to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery-type goods to resell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 43 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Helen has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, noodles, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald came to the U.S. from Haiti about a decade ago, and in 2011, started Empire Investment Business providing legal and licensing services for businesses as well as tax preparation services. Gerald’s business helps him support family in Haiti.

Gerald is proud to see his company grow. He says: “My greatest success is that last year, during the tax season, I had an increase of 50% of new clients. This was linked to my marketing strategy.” And, while the increase in demand for tax services is great, Gerald recognizes that this is seasonal work, and he needs to work on shoring up his customer base for yearlong engagement. He needs a loan to boost his marketing—from buying an electronic rolling sign to sending end-of-year postcards to existing clients.

loans.use: to purchase an electronic rolling sign, radio and print ads, and for marketing outreach to existing clients of his business providing legal and licensing services

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en: Pha, 46, is a farmer living in Kampong Speu Province and is a mother of two children. To meet the needs of her family, she earns income via rice cropping and it earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leading a group of two members to apply for a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family can have clean water to use as other families do.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is 54 years old and a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. For the past five years she has been dealing in tobacco in the Philippines.

Lorie has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of tobacco to resell. She is working hard to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of tobacco to resell.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, 51, is a widow with four children, two of whom are in school. For the past four years she has harvested and sold seaweed in the Philippines.

Trinidad has applied for a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy farm supplies for her seaweed business. Her goal is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her seaweed business.

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
After six months of maintaining and fattening three pigs, Ni Kadek successfully sold them at 5,250,000 IDR. After deducting spending on feed and medicines, the net benefit was 350,000 IDR per month. From these results, Ni Kadek paid off the previous loan to MUK of 1,200,000 IDR and then she and the group of Sombang Lestari requested a new loan to MUK.

These loans are very necessary to increase business capital of pigs, so they can supplement the family income.

Ni Kadek's daily activities are only as a laborer with her husband. Ni Kadek and some friends formed a group of pig farmers that have been running for ten periods. With the help of venture capital loans from MUK of 1,200,000 IDR per member, Ni Kadek formed Sombang Lestari group and she became its group leader.

Ni Kadek will use this loan to buy three local piglets for fattening, each 400,000 IDR. Ni Kadek buys feed with her own money. Ni Kadek hopes that during the next six months, the pigs will grow well and increase the results of their sale.

Obviously the results obtained will be used to meet the cost of living as well as their children's school fees. Support from her husband also encouraged Ni Kadek to work hard with the pig livestock business.

loans.use: to buy three local piglets.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 60 years old, married, and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad, Philippines. She has six children and her husband is a farmer. Vicky has been running a sari-sari store for five years. She enjoys being a member of Paglaum Cooperatives because of the quality services and benefits that she gets from Paglaum. 

Vicky applied for a loan of 3,000 Philippine pesos to buy two sacks of feeds for her piglets—her other source of income. Vicky hopes that in the future she can increase her income through expanding her sari-sari and pig raising businesses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of feeds

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is sixty years old and has four adult children. Her husband is a fisherman, and she sells what he catches.

Myrna became a member of Paglaum last year because of the benefits and other services that the cooperative offers to its members. She has decided to apply for a 3,000 PHP loan to buy another fishing net so as to increase the couple’s catch. She hopes that someday she can own a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy another fishing net

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus, 36, is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. For the past five years she has earned an income by selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Venus has applied for a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell such as pants and jackets. Her desire is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell such as pants and jackets.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 45 years old, married and has seven children, three of whom are in school. For the past two years she has earned an income by selling charcoal in the Philippines.

Marites has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell. She is working hard to make enough money to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta 7ª grado, esta casado y su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica , tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 están estudiando.

Wilberto actualmente trabaja como empleado de seguridad privado tiene 7 años dedicarse a esta profesión, ademas trabaja en la agricultura que lo aprendió desde niño con sus padres que eran agricultores, se traslada 20 kilómetros a motocicleta para poder llegar a su trabajo que es de 24 horas; en la agricultura le ayudan sus 2 hijos mayores.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto y materiales de construcción para su casa.

Desea poder darle el estudio que él no tubo a sus hijos, tener una vivienda mejor a la que hoy tiene.
texts.en:
Wilberto is 39 years old and studied to 7th grade. He is married and his wife works as a domestic employee. He has four children, of whom 3 are in school.

Wilberto works at present as a private security employee. He has seven years of experience in this profession. In addition, he works in agriculture, which he learned from childhood with his parents who were farmers. He travels 20 kilometers on motorcycle to arrive at work for a 24 hour shift. His two eldest children help him with his agricultural work.

The loan he is requesting is for purchasing cattle to graze and construction materials for improving his house.

Wilberto wants to provide his children with the education he never had, and to have a better house than they have today.

loans.use: to buy cattle to graze and construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga, age 49, is a married woman from Dulag, Leyte. A mother of four grown children, she is busy operating her general store. She sells basic household commodities like soy sauce, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, spices and soft drinks. Aside from operating a store, she also raises and sells hogs as an additional source of income.

Dominga has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy assorted items for sale at the store and additional piglets. With this loan, Dominga can offer a wide array of goods, and hopefully raise and sell more pigs in the coming few months.

Dominga would like to expand her business to be successful and eventually to make her family's livelihood more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy assorted items for sale at the store and additional piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise chickens and to continue selling clothing.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old, married, and has eight children, six of whom are in school. 

Vilma is in the fishing business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

Vilma has been involved in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 39 years old and married.

Jonalyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jonalyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a hardworking mother. At the age of 56, a widow, she raised her children to have a better living. She is engaged the business of buying and selling coconuts. With this income, her children continue their studies. She joined Paglum Cooperatives in May of 2013. A chance for her to have an electrical connection is only through borrowing a loan from PMPC. 

Ofelia hopes that someday she can buy a parcel of coconut land to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy electrical wires in order to have electricity.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and three of her children are in school.

Elsa has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

Elsa has been in this business for four years. In the future, Elsa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets and other materials to use in her business.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, 56, is a mother of four children living in Kampong Speu Province. To earn a living, she grows rice as her single source of income to secure the basic need in her household, and the business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day. For Mom, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of five members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can have a decent latrine for using and update her living conditions to make them better than before.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: 16-06-03 Phố 7 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Bình is 38 years old and she is married with one child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.

Bình operates a food stall selling seafood. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Bình faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seafood to resell.

Bình is the group leader of the 16-06-03 Phố 7 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Bình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to resell.

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en:
Marifi is 29 years old, and is married to a motor cab driver. She has one infant child. The income of her husband is enough to meet their daily needs.  

Marifi decided to help her husband by offering door-to-door beauty services. Marifi was very happy when she heard, and became a member, of Paglaum Cooperatives because of the savings scheme and other services that Paglaum offers to its members. She is applying for a loan with the Cooperative to buy cosmetics in order to attract more clients. From her little income, she is now starting to save for her daughter so that in the future she can provide a better education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 37 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. Erlinda has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business. She earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work with three hired fishermen working for her. She has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase another fishing boat for her fish selling business. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Vernecita

texts.en:
Vernecita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 26 years old and has one child in school.

Vernecita has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials to use in her seaweed production business.

Vernecita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Vernecita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to use in her seaweed production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: 16-06-04 Phố 7 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Ms. Lâm has a retail business selling cakes, candies, sugar and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, candy, sugar and soft drinks to resell.

Lâm is 57 years old and she is single with one child. Lâm is the group leader of the 16-06-04 Phố 7 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. This is Lâm's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Lâm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Lâm faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Lâm hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, candies, sugar and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 52, she is single and lives in Oroquieta City. Agnes is operating a store that primarily supports her needs and she is also involved in a load retailing business (prepaid cellphone talk, text and internet cards) for added income. Everyday she never gets tired tending her store. Agnes is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She has religiously repaid her obligations without any record of default. Now, she has requested another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles and soft drinks to sell, and restock load for prepaid cellphone cards. Having enough inventories would result in additional income opportunities for her. In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her needs and also be able to give assistance to her nieces and nephews in their education.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles and soft drinks to sell, and  restock load for retail prepaid cellphone cards (talk,  text and internet).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement blocks, cement, roof tiles, sand, and to pay for labor to finish building his house.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a native man from Dulag, Leyte. He is 46 years old and engaged in producing and selling hollow blocks. Aside from operating his hollow block business, he also engages in farming. He grows and sells rice. He is a father of six children. His youngest child is nine. Three of his children are still attending school. 

Edgardo has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy materials like portland cement, sand and fertilizer. These will help him produce more hollow blocks and increase the harvest of his farm, thus providing his children with quality education and better living conditions.

Edgardo would like to expand his business to be successful in his chosen livelihood in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy materials like portland cement, sand  and ferrtilizer

loans.name: Alijandra

texts.en:
Alijandra is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and her ability to be independent. Her business involves producing school uniforms and repairing clothes. It has given her the opportunity to work and survive. 
Alijandra applied for a loan to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her to generate more income and provide more tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Vergelia

texts.en:
Vergelia is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vergelia is 48 years old and seven of her children are in school.

Vergelia has a seaweed business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her seaweed production business.

Vergelia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Vergelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her seaweed production business

loans.name: Tape Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Koe Pyahu  está en su ciclo número 10  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria.
Ella en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, lo que quiere decir que poco a poco y a través del esfuerzo ha ido mejorando. 
Entre el trabajo que ella realiza cuenta que se dedica a la venta de Lencería, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones.
La Sra. Gloria solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas interiores en general, vaqueros para hombre y mujer entre otros lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The "Koe Pyahu" group is in its 10th loan cycle with the Women's Committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey. 

One of the members is Gloria. In her last survey, she had a poverty level around level three. What this means is that little by little and through hard work, things have been getting better.

Among the jobs she does is the sale of women's intimate clothing. The work done by the advisors should also be noted, bcause they work tirelessly on trainings and verification activitivies. 

Gloria is requesting the loan to buy underwear in general, and jeans for men and women, among other items that will help her to finalize her plan of work, which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy underwear in general, and jeans for men and women, among other items.

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en: Retailing helped Anecia survive for the family. She retails charcoal and brings in a meager income of PHP 5,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling charcoal easy and simple because all she needed to do was to weigh and repack the charcoal for her buyers. Anecia plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail and cut wood for charcoal making. Anecia smiles at seeing all her family members happy with a decent and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of charcoal for retail and cut wood to make charcoal

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 43 years old with one child. She works very hard to help her family.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy piglets for her business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: In 2012, Eva learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it extends. Eva tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Eva borrowed again to pay for seedlings and compost. This will help give her farming income a big boost. Eva looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: 16-04-04 Phố 1 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tươi works in agriculture, raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to buy more baby poultry to raise and sell.

Tươi is 43 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 16-04-04 Phố 1 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

This is Tươi's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in her business for five years and one of the most critical  difficulties she faces is lack of capital.

With her profits, Tươi hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy more baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 66 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba on the island of Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is married with five adult children. For several years, Pacita has made a living from collecting plastic, scrap metal and other recyclable materials, and from coconut production. She has been earning approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. 
Pacita has requested a loan to be used as a down payment on a motorcycle that she will use for her businesses. She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: to make a down payment on a motorcycle

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.

She is 54 years old and married with three children. Hiền lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in her business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hiền hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Virgen De Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Virgen de Lourdes integrado por 20 mujeres, este es un grupo antiguo y fortalecido, se encuentran en el sexto ciclo, ellas son de la ciudad de Santaní, una zona aun en crecimiento y eminentemente rural.
La Sra. Norma, miembro de este comité es distinguida por su labor, antes su actividad se basaba en la cría de animales y trabajaba de limpiadora a la vez. Hoy día a través de los ciclos anteriores, hizo realidad su sueño de contar con una ropería en su propia casa.
Es admirable el espíritu emprendedor de esa señora, quiere seguir creciendo y es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas de todo tipo, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo su sueño de mantener su ropería.
texts.en:
The group called "Virgen de Lourdes" is made up of 20 women. This is an old and strong group, which is in its 6th loan cycle. They're from the city of Santaní, an area that is still growing and is extremely rural.

Norma, a member of the group, is known her her hard work. She used to raise animals and also worked as a cleaning lady at the same time. Nowadays, after the previous loan cycles, she has realized her dream of haveing a clothing store in her own house. 

This woman's enterprising spirit is admirable. She wants to continue growing and this is why she's requesting the loan, to be able to buy all types of clothing. This will allow her to continue with her dream of keeping her clothing store going.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en: Jovito is 50 years old and resides in Oroquieta City. He is married and blessed with two children who are still at their school age. He joined PMPC on May 16, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the Co-op. Recently, he's accessing his 11th loan in the amount of PHP 49,900 for additional working capital for his existing business to buy a variety of commodities to sell in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities to sell in the local community

loans.name: Tám

texts.en:
Mrs. Tám works in agriculture growing vegetables.

Tám is 39 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Tám's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Tám hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is married with three children. She is 57 years old and lives in Ventura Sapang Dalaga in the Philippines. Erlinda is a farmer and grows vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizers and chemicals. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to harvest more vegetable crops and supply a neighboring market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Ma. Nelia

texts.en:
Ma. Nelia is 39 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.

In the future Ma. Nelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hiền

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền has a service business shipping goods.

Hiền is 43 years old and married with one child. Hiền lives with no dependents in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Hiền's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiền has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hiền faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

In the future, Hiền hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Marry Ann

texts.en: Marry Ann came to the right place for the capital she needed when she joined PMPC. Farming is her main source of income and PMPC came to the  rescue to lend her money when she needed it most. Now, she is taking out another loan to pay for the labor she requires for seedbed preparation, such as mounting beds and sowing seeds, and to buy farm inputs. Elena perseveres and always believes in reaching her goal to continue providing for her family. In the future, she wants to buy a hectare of land to expand her farming activities for possible business opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for labor for seedbed preparation and to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Nhớm 5 Thôn 5 - Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiên works in agriculture raising poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hiên is 27 years old and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the Nhớm 5 Thôn 5 - Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of five members. In 2012, Hiên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hiên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hiên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a 31-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has two children ages six and five. Jovelyn helps her husband in their fishing business. This has been their source of income for several years now.
 
Jovelyn wants to take a loan to buy a new boat engine and new fishing nets. This loan will be a great help for them in improving their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Jovelyn hopes to make their fishing business sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and new fishing nets

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 5 -Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Truyền works in agriculture, raising poultry. Truyền has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Truyền faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Truyền is 42 years old, and she is married with three children.

Truyền is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 5 -Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2010, Truyền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Truyền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Truyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 15 Thôn 4 - Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen works in agriculture, raising poultry and pigs. Sen has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Sen faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Sen is 60 years old, and she is married with three children. Sen is the group leader of the Nhóm 15 Thôn 4 - Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of four members.
