In 2009, Sen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sen has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Sen hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Rosita has a garden and plants a variety of root crops. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Rosita borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and fertilizer. This will help give her garden income a big boost. Rosita looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie is a businessman from Oroquieta City in the Philippines. He is a widower and has expertise in selling. He runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meagre income that sufficiently supports his needs. Eddie is a fully fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing, without any problems. Now, he has applied for a loan to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Eddie continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock his store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 24 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Connie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Connie would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 44 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is in school.

Remedios is in the agricultural business, farming root crops in the Philippines. Remedios requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Remedios has been farming root crops for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estrella is 49 years old, and she works very hard to support her family.

Estrella has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business.

Estrella has been in this business for two years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 29 years old and has two children. She is a married woman and both of her children are in school.

Julie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Julie has been in the business for five years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eleuterio Jr

texts.en:
Eleuterio Jr, 29, raises and sells pigs. He also engages in motorcycle transport services. He transports passengers from one place to remote areas for a certain fee. These are his sources of income. He has been engaged in this kind of business for three years now. He has a six-year-old child. Together with his family, he lives in Dulag, Leyte. He has a lack of capital to finance both of his businesses, so he decided to seek other means to continue his livelihood activity. Eleuterio Jr has requested a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and pig feed. He can now raise and sell more pigs in the coming months.

With these, Eleuterio Jr can now provide his family with good food and a quality education. He hopes to have a stable income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Reseau Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe RESEAU est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  NIEBALA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de condiments à l’image de ALIMA qui est la femme assise devant dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 1 carton de cube maggi, 5 sacs de sel et autres avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Reseau group is comprised of four women. On average, they are 29 years old and have three children. They live in nuclear families in the Niebala neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. 

They know one another through neighbors, friends, and business. In order to bolster their finances and improve their business, they joined the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. This is their second loan with the institution. Their previous loan was repaid. 

This women's group buys condiments through Alima, the woman seated in the photo. With her loan, she would like to buy one box of Maggi cube, five bags of salt, and more from the Bougouni wholesalers.  She sells at the market and out of her home. She sells at retail prices for cash and credit to a mixed clientele.

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA that she will use to invest in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: buy condiments.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 54 years old and widowed with one child. She works very hard to support her family.

Leonila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, shampoo, etc.

Leonila has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages and shampoo

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên works in agriculture, farming food.

Liên is 43 years old and married with two children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Liên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 54 years old and has two children. She is a married woman.

Lilia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilia has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilibeth is 47 years old and two of her children are in school.

Lilibeth has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 34 years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Lunilyn

texts.en:
Lunilyn is a single woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lunilyn is 25 years old now.

Lunilyn has a direct selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like blouses, shoes, etc.

Lunilyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lunilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like blouses and shoes

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julián de 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos, dos están con él y dos viajaron al extranjero. Él estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, por no tener la capacidad económica dejo la escuela. Su esposa es ama de casa ella, 2 hijos y una nieta son los que viven con él.

Julián es agricultor también cría animales domésticos, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esto gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron. Camina a diario 15 minutos para llegar al lugar de la siembra, en esta actividad también se involucran sus dos hijos.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un par de novillas aprovechando que el ganado esta barato y para tramitar unos documentos para a su nieta para que viaje al extranjero, pues sus padres la mandan a traer y quiere que se vaya por la vía legal.

Julián espera que todo salga bien con el trámite para que su nieta se reúna con sus padres.
texts.en:
Julián is a farmer and rJulián is 57 years old, married and has four children; two live at home while two decided to travel abroad. Julián has a third grade education. Due to financial difficulties he could not continue any further at school. Julián’s wife is a housewife. Julián and his wife live with two of their children and one granddaughter.

Julián is a farmer and raises animals. He has been doing this work for 12 years, all thanks to his parents who taught him this trade. Julián walks 15 minutes every day in order to arrive at the land where he grows his crops. Julián’s two children also help with this work.

This loan will be used in order to buy a couple of young bulls, taking advantage of low prices. The loan will also be used to pay for documents so that Julián’s granddaughter may travel abroad as her parents want her to travel with them and Julián wants her to travel within the law.

Julián hopes that everything goes well with the papers so that his granddaughter can be reunited with her parents.

loans.use: to buy a couple of young bulls.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Para la compra de frutas.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old and a married woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rowena has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell. She has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and has nine children, one of whom is in school. Lydia is a widowed woman.

Lydia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 43 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena is 44 years old and is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maria Elena has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Maria Elena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 27 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de 1 filho menor de idade, responsabiliza-se pelos seus 2 sobrinhos que vivem em sua casa.
É proprietário de um estabelecimento comercial a mais de 5 anos onde ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa , com empréstimo solicitado pretende ampliar o seu negocio adquirindo produtos como; refrescos, sumos  bebidas e mais. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo. 
Futuramente pretende iniciar uma obra de residência e ampliar o seu negócio abrindo outros estabelecimentos comerciais. O seu maior desafio é  tonar-se um grande empreendedor ao nível do Distrito.
texts.en: Born in Namaacha province, in Maputo, the borrower is 27 years old. He is a married father to a young son and is also financially responsible for his two nieces and nephews who live with him. He has been a shop owner for the last 5 years, from which he earns an income that he uses to pay for his household expenses. He will use this loan to expand his business by buying more stock, such as refreshments, fruit juices and other items. This will be his third loan and, in the future, he hopes to start building his own home and further expand his business by opening new shops. The greatest challenge he faces is in becoming a great, District-level entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy products, such as refreshments, fruit juices and other items

loans.name: Sualei

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Pebane Província de Zambézia tem 42 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 3 filhos menores de idade todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
Trabalha na G4S como Segurança onde aufere um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com valor solicitado pretende dar continuidade a sua obra de residência adquirindo material de construção como areia e cimento. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo na hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura para iniciar um negócio de venda de madeira e garantir o ensino da sua esposa
texts.en:
Born in Pebane province, in Zambezia, the borrower is 42 years old. He is a married father to 3 young children who all attend school, and he is also financially responsible for his niece who lives with him in his family home.
He works as a security guard for G4S from which he earns an income that he spends on his household expenses. With this loan, he wants to continue with building work on his home and he will use the loan to buy the materials needed, such as sand and cement. This will be his 5th loan with Hluvuku and, in the future, he hopes to buy a vehicle so that he can start a business selling wood and pay for his wife's education.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as sand, cement and stone.

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SÉRIEUX est constitué de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  NIEBALA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers à l’image de SALI qui est la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 4 pièces de pagnes, 5 sacs de patates, 4 régimes de banane avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Sérieux group is made up of married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have five children. They live in nuclear families in the Niebala neighborhood in the village of Bougouni. The group members know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

In order to strengthen their financial capacity so as to better conduct their businesses, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The group is now on their third loan. The previous two loans have been repaid correctly.

This group of women works selling various goods, like Sali, who is the woman seated second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy four lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric], five sacs of potatoes, and four bunches of bananas from the wholesalers in Bougouni.

Sali makes her sales at retail from the market and from home for cash and credit to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan helped her to really establish her business. She was able to purchase additional clothing items needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her to provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is positive that she can improve her business more if you now lend her the amount of 18,000 PHP. This new loan will go on additional stocks of clothing items like pants, polo shirts, shorts for kids, different dresses, shirts and other products for resale in her business. Her customers are likely to buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will be able to sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Imelda dreams of traveling around the world. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products like pants, polo shirts, shorts for kids, different dresses, shirts and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school and Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Amade

texts.pt:
O sr Amade, tem 49 anos de idade, casado e pai de uma filha que está a frequentar a licenciatura. Para além da sua filha, tem na sua responsabilidade o seu irmão que também frequenta o ensino superior. 
Ele vai usar o empréstimo para comprar material de construção como  portões e alguns sacos de cimento para colocar no muro da sua casa como forma de segurança
O  seu maior desafio é concretizar o sonho e reembolsar o emprestimo dentro do prazo estabelecido.
texts.en:
Amade is a 49-year-old married father whose daughter is currently studying for a degree. Asides from his daughter, he is also financially responsible for his sister who is also in higher education.
He will use this loan to buy building materials, such as gates and sacks of cement, so that he can construct a wall around his house for added security. The greatest challenge that he faces is realizing his dream and repaying his loan within the predefined period.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as gates and sacks of cement.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DANAYA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4ème prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce   d’articles divers à l’image de SAFIATOU qui est la 2ème femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 4 pièces de pagnes et 3 cartons de savon avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of five married women who, on average, are 25 years old and have three children. They live in traditional extended families in the Heremakono Nord area in the town of Bougouni. The group members know each other through neighborhood, friendship, and business ties.

To strengthen their financial capacity in order to better conduct their businesses, the group members joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are now on their fourth loan. Their previous three loans have been repaid correctly. 

This group of women works selling various goods, like Safiatou, who is seated second from the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy four lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] and three boxes of soap from the wholesalers in Bougouni.

Safiatou makes her sales at retail from the market and from home, for cash and credit, to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested into her business and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Suzie

texts.en:
Suzie is 43 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Suzie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from tobacco retail.

Suzie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Incha-La Group

texts.fr:
Mme FANTA est maintenant responsable du groupe INCHA-LA. Nadine a quitté le groupe. Mariée, FANTA est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 03 vont à l’école.06 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes, sacs à main et de l'huile consommable depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages.
Elle veut s’acheter 20complets pagnes et 05bidons d'huile.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne construire une maison d'habitation.
texts.en:
Fanta is now the leader of the Incha-la group after Nadine withdrew. Married, Fanta is the mother of five children, with the oldest being 30 years old and the youngest being 18 years old. Three of the children attend school. She has six [additional] people under her care.

Fanta has been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric], handbags, and cooking oil for 20 years. She procures her goods in the villages. [With this loan], she wants to buy 20 pagne outfits and five drums of oil. 

With her earnings, she wants to reinvest in her business. She dreams of building a house [one day].

loans.use: to buy 20 pagne outfits and five drums of oil

loans.name: Rabiatou

texts.fr:
Mme RABIATOU est mariée et mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. Les 03 vont à l'école. Elle a 02presonnes en charge.
Mme fait le commerce de pagnes, chaussures depuis 04ans. Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé (TOGO). 
Elle veut s'acheter 40pièces de pagnes et 20chaussures.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mme ambitionne acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Rabiatou is married and a mother of three children, of whom the eldest is 12 years old and the youngest is five years old. All three children attend school. She also has two [additional] people under her care.

Rabiatou has been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] and shoes for four years. She procures her goods in Lomé in Togo. 

[With this loan], she wants to buy 40 lengths of pagnes and 20 pairs of shoes. 

Rabiatou wants to reinvest her earnings into her business. She hopes [one day] to acquire a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy 40 lengths of pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] and 20 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Apriyanus

texts.en:
This is the story of Apriyanus:

"I come from the island of Nias, precisely in the village of Gomo Sifaoroasi, in North Sumatra. My village is very quiet, and the houses in my area are small. Due to the nature and situation of many large estates, most of the residents of our village are subsistence farmers in the fields or construction workers in the city. My parents works as laborers in the fields, and their earnings are minimal. Sometimes the weather also affects my parents' income as if the weather is bad, the harvest can be very small. Even if the rice fields are flooded, there can be crop failure, and then my parents do not make any money. To overcome this, my father also works as a construction worker in the city, so for several months I have to be apart from him. I am very sad, seeing my father struggle just to pay for my school, but it is my father's wish that I follow higher education. Through the Kiva program at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN), I am applying for this loan to finance my college education at AMN for 3 years. These loans can ease the burden on my parents. Thanks to the lender, and may God bless you. "

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Tưởng

texts.en:
Tưởng works in agriculture, farming food. He is 34 years old and married with 2 children. He lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Tưởng has been involved in farming for more than 10 years. The main hardship that he faces in his life is not having a hygienic latrine, so he is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

This is Tưởng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With his business profit, Tưởng hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for his kids, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nejoniheza Group

texts.fr:
François fait partie du groupe  Nejoniheza  et  habite à  Bubanza. Il  a  25 ans et est marié à Irène, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 2 semaines à 4 ans.

Il fait le commerce de pomme de terre, de bière de banane et de la bière industrielle depuis 10 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de pomme de terre  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait devenir un commerçant grossiste et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
François is a member of the Nejoniheza group and lives in Bubanza. He is 25 years old and is married to Irène, a merchant. Together they have three children, aged from two weeks to four years. 

François has worked selling potatoes, banana beer, and manufactured beer for ten years. This is his second loan through Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital to buy a large amount of potatoes to resell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to become a wholesaler and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of potatoes to resell

loans.name: Turwanyinzara Ii Group

texts.fr:
Réverien fait partie du groupe  Turwanyinzara et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a  51 ans et est marié à Pascasie, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 3 à 26 ans, dont  5 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de poules et de chèvres  depuis 3 ans. 

C’est à son premier  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de poules et de chèvres  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait devenir un commerçant grossiste, et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Réverien is a member of the Turwanyinzara II group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 51 years old and is married to Pascasie, a merchant. Together they have eight children, aged from three to 26 years old. Five of the children attend school. 

Réverien has been selling chickens and goats for three years. This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital to buy many chickens and goats, which he will resell to earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to become a wholesaler and see his children attend school.

loans.use: to buy chickens and goats to resell

loans.name: Twungubumwe Group

texts.fr:
Estella fait partie du groupe  Twungubumwe  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à J. Marie, un avocat. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants l’un a 1 an et l’autre 4 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, farine,…) depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de farine, de haricot et de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle  et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Estella is a member of the Twungubumwe group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 32 years old and is married to a J. Marie, who is a lawyer. Together they have two children, aged one and four years old. 

Estella has worked in commerce (selling beans, rice, flour, etc.) for two years. She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large amount of flour, beans, and rice, which she will resell and earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to buy a piece of land and see her children attend school.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of flour, beans, and rice to resell

loans.name: Kadahoka Group

texts.fr:
Thérèse fait partie du groupe  Kadahoka   et  habite à  Bubanza. C’est une veuve de 46 ans. Elle a 7 enfants âgés  2 à 26 ans.

Elle fait le commerce du  riz depuis 2 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle  et voir ses  enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Thérèse is a member of the Kadahoka group and lives in Bubanza. She is 46 years old and a widow. She has seven children, aged from two years old to 26 years old. 

Thérèse has been selling rice for two years. She is on her second loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, she is going to increase her capital to buy a large amount of rice, which she will resell to earn more. 

In the coming years, she would like to buy a piece of land and see her children attend school.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of rice to resell

loans.name: Sanabubu

texts.ru: Санабубу, 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитала 4 детей. У Санабубу средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она около 15 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Санабубу, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 2,50 ГА земли, где она выращивает картофель и фасоль. Также у Санабубу в хозяйстве есть 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Санабубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на ремонт сарая. Санабубу намерена улучшить условия содержания скота, что позволит ей получить здоровый приплод и в дальнейшем увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Sanabubu is 54 years old, married and has raised four children together with her husband. Sanabubu has vocational education. As a main source of income for her family, she has worked with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding for a period of around 15 years. 

Thanks to Sanabubu's persistance, purposefulness and hard work, she currently has 2.50 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and haricots. She also has 15 sheep on her farm. The monthly income from the agricultural busienss is around 15,000 som (KGS). 

Sanabubu turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) to repair her barn. Sanabubu intends to improve the conditions for the livestock, which will allow her to get healthy offspring from them and in the future increase the number of lifestock.

loans.use: to repair her livestock barn

loans.name: Bukalicha

texts.ru: Букалича, 53 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. Образование-среднее. Дети взрослые, младшая дочь живет с матерью и помогает по хозяйству. С 1992 года Букалича занимается сельским хозяйством - животноводством. В хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 5 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль Букаличи составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS). Этого безусловно не хватает на достойную жизнь Букаличи и ее детей, поэтому она решила развить свою сельскохозяйственную деятельность, так как это единственный источник доходов. Букалича обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от бизнеса Букалича будет вкладывать в дальнейшее его развитие, чтобы иметь возможность улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en:
Bukalicha is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children. She has secondary education. Her children are adults. The youngest daughter lives with her mother and helps with the household. Bukalicha has worked with agriculture since 1992, specifically livestock breeding. She has one cow and five sheep on her farm. 

Bukalicha's monthly income is around 7,000 som (KGS). This is certainly not enough for a decent life for Bukalicha and her children. Therefore she decided to develop her agricultural business, as this is her only source of income. 

Bukalicha turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestok. She plans to invest the income from the business in further developing it, in order to have the opportunity to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her income

loans.name: Perizat

texts.ru: Перизат, 36 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей дошкольного возраста. У нее высшее образование, 12 лет работает преподавателем в университете. Оклад Перизат 11,500 сом (KGS), все средства она старается вкладывать в образование и воспитание ее детей, потому что дети - главная ценность в жизни Перизат. Однако в этом году ей нужно утеплить пол в доме, так как есть маленькие дети, и Перизат беспокоится об их здоровье. Поэтому она обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ламината, линолеума и прочего. А заработную плату Перизат будет вкладывать в своих детей.
texts.en:
Perizat is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children of pre-school age. She has higher education and has worked as a university teacher for 12 years. Perizat's salary is 11,500 som (KGS). She strives to invest all the funds in her children's upbringing and education, as they are the most valuable in her life. 

However, this year she needs to insulate the floors of their home, as the children are young and she worries about their health. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase laminate, linoleum and other materials. Perizat will then be able to use her salary on her children.

loans.use: to purchase laminate, linoleum and other materials in order to insulate the floor of her house

loans.name: Zina

texts.ru: Зина, 63 года, вдова, дети взрослые и самостоятельные. У Зины среднее образование, она с 1999 года ведет свой бизнес, которым и занимается до сих пор. Зина имеет собственный торговый павильон, где продает женские куртки, халаты, спортивные костюмы и прочую одежду. Благодаря упорному труду Зины, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль по сезону колеблется от 25,000 сом до 40,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку женской одежды для перепродажи на осенне-зимний сезон. Зина считает, что увеличив ассортимент она сможет привлечь больше покупателей и увеличить общую прибыль. Зина планирует расширить ее бизнес и накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zina is 63 years old and a widow. Her children are adults and independent. Zina has secondary ecucation. Since 1999 she has had her own business, which she continues to work with. Zina has her own sales pavillion, where she sells women's jackets, gowns, tracksuits and other garnments. Thanks to Zina's persistent work, her monthly income for the season ranges from 25,000 to 40,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase women's clothing to sell in the autumn and winter season. Zina things that after increasing the assortment she will be able to attract more customers and increase the total income. Zina plans to expand her business and save money for renovating her home.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes for selling in order to increase the assortment and provide better variety for her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabric and other sewing supplies to continue her business

loans.name: Bonswendsongré Group

texts.fr: Rasmata, emprunteur représentatif est une veuve et mère de 3 enfants scolarisés. Cette courageuse dame fait la restauration depuis 20 ans et à 3 employés qui l'aide dans son activité qu'elle rémunère chaque mois. Ce prêt permettra à Rasmata de payer du riz pour stocker, les condiments, les épices et autre produits nécessaires pour sa cuisine. Vu son expérience dans le domaine de la restauration, il faut souligner que Rasmata est une femme battante qui a une clientèle varié. le bénéfice issue de ce prêt permettra à cette dame de continuer son activité, de solder la scolarité de ses enfants et de continuer à soutenir ses employés. Le groupe de Rasmata fait parti des meilleurs clients de ACFIME, en plus de cela, les remboursements se font normalement et à la bonne date.
texts.en: Rasmata, who is the representative borrower of the group, is a widow and mother to three children, who are all educated. This brave woman has been carrying out a restauration business for the past 20 years and has three employees whom she pays every month to help her with the business. This loan will enable Rasmata to stock up on rice and to buy condiments, spices and other products necessary for cooking. Given her experience in the restauration field, it should be highlighted that Rasmata is a fighting woman who has a varied customer base. The profit she makes as a result of this loan will allow this woman to continue her business to pay off her children's schooling costs and to continue to pay her employees. Rasmata's group is one of ACFIME's best customers and, as well as this, their repayments are made in full and on time.

loans.use: to get supplies of drinks and products for cooking in her restaurant.

loans.name: Fayida Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FAYIDA ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments.
Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FAYIDA sont à leur 4ième   prêt solidaire. Louissi , 2ème femme de la droite vers la  gauche  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  100 complets de prêt à porter pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 36 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Fayida group average 37 years of age with three children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). These women got to know each other through family and have small businesses buying and selling cereals, condiments and a variety of other products.

Having repaid all their previous loans in full, the women in the group are on their fourth group loan. Louissi, who is sitting second from the right in the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 100 sets of ready-to-wear children's clothing. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She sells her clothes to a customer base made up of both men and women, for cash and often on credit.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 36,000FCFA which will be used for health costs, food, clothing and school fees; the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME ont en moyenne 37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TENE/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des céréales et des condiments.
 Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe sont à leur 11ème   prêt solidaire. MASSIRE, 1ère  assise de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  100kgs de sucre, 10 paquets de bonbons, 10 paquets de cube Maggi, 10 paquets de biscuits et 10 paquets chewing-gum. Elle s’approvisionne sur place avec les boutiquiers. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguisseme group average 37 years of age with three children each, and they all live in traditional extended families in Tene/Ségou (the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region). These women got to know each other through family and have small businesses buying and selling cereals, condiments and a variety of other products. 

Having repaid all their previous loans in full, the women in the group are on their 11th group loan. Massire, who is sitting on the right of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of sugar, ten packets of candy, ten packets of Maggi stock cubes, ten packets of biscuits and ten packets of chewing gum. She gets her supplies locally from shop owners. She sells her products to a customer base made up of both men and women, for cash and often on credit. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA which will be used for health costs, food, clothing and school fees; the rest will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Kékéli Abra

texts.fr: KEKELI est âgée de 24 ans, célibataire avec un enfant en sa charge ; elle vit au quartier d’Adidogomé et fait le commerce des habits cousus, s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé. Elle a un niveau d’étude primaire, et vit dans une maison dont le toit est en tôle. KEKELI sollicite un microcrédit pour plus acheter, prendre en charge la scolarité de son enfant et mieux épargner et si possible vivre un jour dans sa propre maison.
texts.en: Kekeli is 24 years old and single, and she has one child in her care. She lives in the Adidogomé district and sells clothes that she makes. She gets her supplies three times a month at Lomé's Grand Market. She has a primary level of education and lives in a house with a roof made of sheet metal. Kekeli is requesting a microloan so she can buy more, pay for her child's education and save more money, and also if possible live in her own house one day.

loans.use: to buy six pieces of "pagne" fabric.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a tuba (coconut) wine entrepreneur. She makes and sells tuba wine.  In addition to that, she also engages in a gasoline retail business.  She is a 46-year-old married woman, and has two children, ages 22 and 11. 

In order to sustain her daily earnings, Elsa has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy an additional stock of gasoline, coconut wine, and feed. 
Elsa dreams of opening a small store, and she sells animal feed for chickens and pigs. These will help her improve her way of living.

Elsa would like to expand her both businesses to support the education of her youngest child, and also to provide them with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of gasoline, coconut wine, and feed

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is a 46-year-old widow, and a mother of four children. She lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is engaged in selling home cooked foods to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for the past 10 years now. 

Janita needs additional capital for her business. She is now asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, cooking oil, and condiments. The loan will allow her to improve her ingredients, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

She hopes of improving the sustainability of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like vegetables, meat, cooking oil, and condiments

loans.name: 09 Thắng Lộc Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Thúy is 24 years old, and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 09 Thắng Lộc Ngư Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2013, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thúy has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase fish to sell.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more fish

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Phu Nhi Group

texts.en:
Điều is 37 years old and she is married with 3 children. Điều works in agriculture raising poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future. Điều has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Điều faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Điều is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Phu Nhi solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. In 2012, Điều joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Điều has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Điều hopes to build a new house, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional merchandise needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business even more if she can borrow an amount of 35,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stock of different undergarments. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her clothing business, Imelda wants to have an extension to their house which she will operate for rental business. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like undergarments to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Jean is 45 years old and has one child in school.

Mary Jean has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Mary Jean has been in this business for a year. In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 61 years old. She is single and has a business selling bananas in the Philippines.

Sofia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Sofia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 46 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Virginia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Digna Maribel

texts.es:
MARIBEL tiene 22 años y vive en Borbón un sector muy pobre de la Provincia de Esmeraldas con sus padres y sus 2 pequeños hijos es madre soltera y no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda de su ex conviviente.
es cliente de FODEMI desde hace un año y está gestionando su 2° crédito para comercializar con cangrejo.cabe indicar que el crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra venta de sabanas.
ella cree que en unos 5 años podrá obtener las ganancias necesarias para comprarse su propia embarcación y un motor fuera de borda para tener la comodidad de movilizar su producto.
dice MARIBEL que en su comunidad no cuentan con servicios de agua potable ni centros de salud. y los créditos ofrecidos por FODEMI han ayudado a mucha gente a progresar en sus ideas de negocios.y a través de estos beneficiar a sus familiares.

INFORMACION ADICIONAL
MARIBEL es quien se encuentra cargando el pequeño niño. debido a que en el principio el grupo era de 7 personas y por razones internas del grupo se realizó créditos individuales.
texts.en:
Maribel is 22 years old and lives in Borbón, a very poor regiona in Esmeraldas Province, with her parents and two young children. She is a single mother and does not receive and kind of help from her ex-partner.

She has been a client of FODEMI for one year and she is managing her second loan to sell crabs. She says that she invested her previous loan in buying sheets. She thinks that in five years, she will have made enough money to buy her own boat and an off-board motor so that she has the comfort of being able to source her own product.

Maribel says that her community has no drinking water or health centres. The loands offered by FODEMI have helped many people to move forwards with their business ideas and through them, support their families.

Additional information:
Maribel is the woman holding the small child. At the beginning, there was a group of seven of them, but for internal issues, the group members requested loans individually.

loans.use: to buy and sell crabs and continue selling sheets.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.fr: Revendeuse des fruits, CHARLOTTE est mariée et mère de trois enfants et est âgée de 28 ans. Elle vit au quartier d’Adidogomé dans une maison qu’elle a loué et dont le toit est en tôle . CHARLOTTE s’approvisionne deux fois  par mois. Elle souhaiterait un appui financier pour plus s’approvisionner afin d’augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire et faire d’économie qui servira à soutenir son mari dans les dépenses du foyer.
texts.en: Charlotte sells fruit. She is married with three children and is 28 years old. She lives in the Adidogome district in a rented home with a sheet metal roof. Charlotte buys her supplies twice every month. She would like financial support to be able to buy more stock in order to improve her profit margin.This will   enable her to save money which she will use to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy three baskets of bananas and one basket of oranges.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De Santa Eulalia Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE SANTA EULALIA” está conformada por socios dedicados al comercio minorista. Margarita tiene 45 años de edad es casada con 04 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía artística con su esposo. Ellos elaboran  materiales didácticos para centros iníciales letreros y murales hechos a base de trupan y pintura acrílica. Actividad que realiza hace 28 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más materiales trupan madera pintura tiner base cola clavos lijas y formica. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Margarita es la segunda persona entada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The Group “LAS EMPRENDEDORAS DE SANTA EULALIA” is comprised by members who work in small scale commerce. Margarita is 45 years old, married and has four dependent children. She works with her husband selling artistic handcrafts. They make teaching materials for schools, signs and murals made with trupan wood and acrylic paint. She has worked in this for 28 years. She will use the loan to buy more materials: trupan wood, wood, paint, thinners, base, glue, nails, sandpaper and formica. The group is grateful to the KIVA lenders for the given loan. Margarita is the second seated person from the left.

loans.use: to buy more trupan, acrylic paint, thinner and glue

loans.name: Médessé

texts.fr: MEDESSE est mariée et mère de sept enfants ; âgée de 52 ans, elle vend du riz mélangé avec du haricot et s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé, loge à Adidogomé dans une maison dont le toit est en tôle, se nourrit une fois par jour. MEDESSE désire un crédit pour soutenir son commerce, mieux épargner et partager les charges avec son mari et surtout répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’augmenter.
texts.en: Medesse is married with seven children; at 52 years old she sells rice mixed with beans and buys her supplies once a month at the big market in Lome. She lives in Adidogome in a house with a sheet metal roof, and eats once a day. Medesse requests a loan to support her business, save more, share the expenses with her husband and above all, to satisfy the demand of her clientele that is increasing constantly.

loans.use: to buy 10 bowls of beans and 10 bowls of rice.

loans.name: Marjorie Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Marjorie, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos  hijos, uno de 6 años y un bebé de 11 meses, el mayor estudia en y escuela. El marido se dedica a la pesca.
Doña Marjorie para salir adelante tienen una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí venden todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, aguas, colas, carnes, legumbres, ciertas cosas de bazar, entre otros  productos de primera necesidad, trabaja todos días y sus ventas son muy buenas ya que su tienda está bien ubicada y no hay muchas tiendas cerca de la suya por esta razón sus clientes la prefieren y también por la buena atención que ella les brinda a sus clientes. Tiene más de 14 años con su negocio con el cual se gana lo suyo y está atenta a las necesidades de su hogar.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos les ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Amigas Solidarias lending group meets every two weeks in the Crucita Parrish, area of the Portoviejo settlement.  This area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this beautiful place and are well visited by local and international tourists.  It’s known as “Crucita la Bella.”

Marjorie lives here.  She is 30 years old, is in a live in relationship, and has two children, ages 6 and 11 months.  The older child attends school.  Her husband is a fisherman. 

Marjorie has a food store in her home and sells all types of products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergents, bottled water, colas, meats, beans, sundries, and other personal products.  She works every day and her sales are good because her store is in a good location and there are not many stores nearby, so her customers prefer to buy from her for this reason and for her good service.  She has been doing this for more than 14 years and earns a living and is able to provide for her household needs.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her store with rice, sugar, cooking oil, and other personal products.  She has been with the lending group for four cycles and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her.  He dream is for her store to grow more each day.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Corina Guadalupe

texts.es: Corina vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 6 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, charamuscas, refrescos, granos básicos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Corina lives in a home of her own with her husband and three children.  She has had a small store in her home for six years, where she sells a variety of products such as snacks, firewood, soft drinks, basic grains, gelatin, sugar, etc.  She has many customers because of her good prices.  [Corina] is asking for this loan to buy more products in quantity since this is her only source of income and this will allow her to increase her earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Dúo Torrelianas Group

texts.es: Dúo Torrelianas Elmar Anibal es padre de familia de 4 hijos al que tenia que ayudar y sacar adelante, hace 15 años inicio a vender en su casa el inicio con un capital de Q500.00 que en aquel entonces era mucho dinero y el fue creciendo y fue creciendo su negocio a la fecha el anda vendiendo como ambulante y en su casa porque ha visto que ha crecido cada dia y ahora con la ayuda de fape el da gracias a Dios por la oportunidad y la confianza ya que por medio de los credito ha tenido prograso en su negocio, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de usos domesticos para la venta como lo son chamarras cubrecamas y mas
texts.en:
Dúo Torrelianas

Elmar Anibal is the father of four children whom he must help and support.  He started selling things out of his home 15 years ago and started with only Q500, which was a lot of money in those days.  The business grew and grew and today he sells on foot as well as from his home because he has seen that the business continues to grow each day.  Now, with help from FAPE, and thanks to God for the opportunity and trust via the loans, he has been able to move ahead with his business.  He is asking for this loan to buy personal products such as jackets, bedspreads, and more.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Henry Atilio

texts.es: Henry de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el es propietario de una tortillería desde hace 8 años y su compañera de vida es quien las elabora, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con su negocio y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su compañera de vida.
texts.en: Henry is 33 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife.  He has owned a tortilla factory for eight years and his wife is the one who makes them.  His business is out of his home and he has many customers.  He is asking for a loan to buy dried corn by the bushel, and lime so that he can continue his business and have a better income and provide a better quality of life for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia Yanira

texts.es: Cecilia de 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ella solicita un crédito  para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, platanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en: Cecilia is 36 years old and is a single mother who lives with her four children in a home of her own.  She makes and sells appetizers such as fried potatoes and yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc.  Her business is located near her home.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies and ingredients such as cooking oil, potatoes, dried corn for the tamales, and plantains.  This way she will be able to continue cooking, supporting her household, and pay any expenses that come up.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria de 50 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 20 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 50 years old and is a single mother.  She lives in a home of her own, has been selling tortillas out of her home for 20 years, and has many customers.  Maria is asking for this loan to buy dried corn in quantity, and lime so that she can continue making tortillas.  This way she can have a better income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nicolas Adilio

texts.es: Don Nicolas de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, pan dulce, refrescos, granos básicos, sopas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, Don Nicolas está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Nicolas is 60 years old and lives with his wife.  He has a small store in his home, where he sells a variety of products such as candy, sweet bread, soft drinks, basic grains, soups, sugar, etc.  He has many customers because of the good prices.  Nicolas is asking for a loan to buy more products in quantity, since this is his only means source of income and he will be able to increase his earnings and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: San Bartolome Group

texts.es: El grupo “SAN BARTOLOME” está conformada por socios dedicados a diversas activadas del comercio minorista a la agricultura. Beatriz tiene 47  años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas al por mayor frutas  de estación palta chirimoya manzana.  Y a la vez cultivas frutas de estación de su zona en el cual radica. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas frutas al por mayor. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Beatriz se encuentra sentada al medio viste buzo azul y zapatillas blancas.
texts.en: The “SAN BARTOLOME” group is made up of members dedicated to different things from small businesses to farming.  Beatriz is 47 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  She buys and sells seasonal fruit in quantity, such as avocados and apples.  She also raises seasonal fruit from her area.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more fruit in quantity.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loan.  Beatriz is seated in the center and is wearing blue sweats and white shoes.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits.

loans.name: G.s Mujeres De Lucha Group

texts.es:
La  señora Mirta es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al negocio propio que es la venta de abarrotería en general, actividad que realiza desde hace 10 años, las ventas las realiza en su casa de habitación sus  clientes principales son vecinos y amigos de su comunidad.
Doña Mirta está solicitando el préstamo solicita para la compra de aceite, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, café, leche, huevos, queso. Etc. productos que necesita para surtir su negocio, espera que esta inversión le permita obtener las ganancias necesarias para salir adelante con su familia.
Doña Mirta sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y mejorar su nivel de vida familiar.
Doña Ana se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de abarrotería y cuenta con  8 años de experiencia. 
Doña Ramona se dedica a la venta de comida y nacatamales actividad que realiza desde hace 13 años.
Doña Blanca se dedica a la venta de golosinas desde hace 7 años.
Doña Elvira tiene una pulpería desde hace varios años.

Danlí, Honduras - Octubre 2014
texts.en:
Mirta is an enterprising woman.  She is devoted to her own business, which is selling groceries.  She has been engaged in this business activity for ten years.  She makes her sales at her house.  Her main customers are her neighbors and friends in her community.

Mirta is requesting the loan to buy cooking oil, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, milk, eggs, and cheese, etc.  These are the products she needs to stock her business.  She hopes that this investment will allow her to get the earnings needed to get ahead with her family.

Mirta dreams of being able to expand her business and improving her family’s standard of living.

Ana devotes herself to commerce.  Her main business activity is selling groceries.  She has eight years of experience.

Ramona sells food and ‘nacatamales’ [corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf].  She has been doing this for 13 years.

Blanca has been selling sweets for seven years.

Elvira has had a grocery store for several years.

Danlí, Honduras – October, 2014

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, beans, sugar, rice, coffee, milk, eggs, and cheese, etc.

loans.name: Teresa Virginia

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Teresa, tiene 40 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 21, 19, 14 y 5 años de edad, los tres menores estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela, tres aun viven con ella. Su esposo trabaja en un bus de transporte.
Doña Teresa es una muy buena madre y ama casa que además de atender su hogar también se dedica a la cría de pollos y gallinas criollas, ella  tiene una pequeña granja en su casa, compra los pollos cuando aun están pequeños y luego los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses a los pollos los cuales mantiene en un corral, las gallinas por su parte las cría sueltas, ella las mantiene por un tiempo y luego cuando están listos los entrega a comerciantes y también les vende a los vecinos de la localidad, con esto se gana lo suyo para el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento para los pollos y gallinas. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Amigas Solidarias lending group meets every two weeks in the Crucita Parrish, area of the Portoviejo settlement.  This area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this beautiful place and are well visited by local and international tourists.  It’s known as “Crucita la Bella.”

Teresa lives here.  She is 40 years old, married, and has four children, ages 21, 19, 14, and 5.  The three youngest attend university, high school, and elementary school and still live with her.  Her husband works as a bus driver.

Teresa is a very good mother and housewife.  Besides caring for the home, she also raises chickens and has a small chicken farm at her home.  She buys the chickens when they are small, keeps them for three months as free range and sells them to merchants when they are ready.  She also sells to local residents.  This is how she earns a living for herself and her family.

She will use the money from this loan to buy chicken feed.  She has been with the lending group for four years and she likes it because the loans are a great help to her.  Her dream is to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Commerçante de divers produits de beauté, ABAVI est mariée et mère de deux enfants, et est âgée de 27 ans. Elle vit à Tokoin et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché d’Adidogomé ; elle a un niveau d’étude secondaire, se soigne par automédication. ABLAVI souhaiterait un microcrédit pour augmenter son approvisionnement afin de mieux gagner et aussi aider son mari dans les dépenses de leur foyer.
texts.en: Abavi sells various beauty products. She is 27 years old and married with two children. She lives in Tokoin and buys her supplies twice monthly at the Adidogome market; she went to school until the secondary level and takes care of herself by self-medication. Abavi requests a loan to be able to buy more supplies in order to earn more and also to help her husband with their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy three dozen hair extensions, 34 units of hair for weaving and three dozen units of beauty cream.

loans.name: Raúl Ernesto

texts.es:
Raúl de 24 años de edad, quien se dedica a la mecánica automotriz, actualmente Padre soltero de 2 pequeños hijos.

Raúl repara llantas, a sus 13 años ya trabajaba en un taller de su cuñado y ahora es dueño de su propio negocio, a su trabajo se une su tío.

 El préstamo que Raúl esta solicitando le serviría para comprar llantas y lubricantes para su negocio, todo con el fin de que la atención de sus clientes sea mejorada y cuando ellos lleguen a buscar el producto él tenga la facilidad de poderlos otorgar.

A futuro sus metas a seguir son ampliar su negocio para obtener muy buenas ganancias. Darles a sus hijos un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Raúl, age 24, is an auto mechanic.  He is the single father of two small children.

Raúl repairs tires.  When he was 13 he was already working in his brother-in-law’s shop.  Now he is the proprietor of his own business.  His uncle joins him in his work.

Raúl will use the loan that he is requesting to buy tires and lubricants for his business.  All of this is so that he will improve his customer service and to be able to give his customers what they are looking for.

His goals for the future are to continue to expand his business in order to get very good earnings and to give his children a promising future.

loans.use: to buy tires and lubricants for his business.

loans.name: 16-08-04 Phố 5 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thương works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Thương is 42 years old and she is married with three children. Thương is the group leader of the 16-08-04 Phố 5 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Phú Nhi Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy, 37 years old, is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Phú Nhi Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years, raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future. Thủy is married and has 3 children. 

Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2012 to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Thủy hopes to build a new house, that her children find good jobs and that her family be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 16-08-06Phố 5 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ, 30 years old, is the group leader of the 16-08-06phố 5 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. For the past 8 years, Huệ has operated a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell, 

Huệ is married and has 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional ready-to-wear items and other merchandise products needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business further if you will let her borrow an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of clothing items for men and women and other merchandise of the same kind. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could cover the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Marilyn aims to send her children to college and she wants to buy a new car. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and brick flooring to improve the floor of her house.

loans.name: 16-08-07 Phố 5 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
