Mrs. Hảo, 26 years old, is the group leader of the 16-08-07 Phố 5 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Hảo has operated a retail business selling clothes for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

Hảo is married and has 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 

This is Hảo's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main hardship that Hảo faces in her business is lack of capital. With her business profit, Hảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Mirian Haydee

texts.es: Mirian de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias,  tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Mirian  esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Mirian is 44 years old and lives in a home of her own, with her four children.  She sells clothing on foot, within the various neighborhoods and  has many steady customers because of the quality of the clothing and the good prices.  Mirian is asking for a loan to buy more men’s and women’s clothing in quantity so she can continue with her sales and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Zenobio

texts.es:
Zenobio tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa y sus 02 hijos. El domicilio del cliente se ubica en el Caserío Huaca Pampa, en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú. La comunidad donde vive Zenobio es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se conocen y dan buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Zenobio se dedica a la actividad de sembrar café variedad Catimor. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en mantenimiento del terreno cultivable. Esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Zenobio is 44 years old and lives in his own house (which is made of rustic materials) with his wife and 2 children. His home is located in the village of Huaca Pampa in the province of Ferreñafe in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Perú. The community where Zenobio lives is a small rural area where the people know him and give him good personal and work references. People in his community mostly work as farmers, with livestock, and in business. 
Zenobio grows the Catimor variety of coffee. He will use the loan to invest in maintaining his cultivable land. This investment will bring him income to improve his economic situation and, hence, to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his cultivated land.

loans.name: Adela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Adela vive junto a sus 3 hijos quienes se dedican a la actividad de la pesca artesanal, durante su época de estudio ella asistió nada más hasta tercer grado de educación básica, por falta de dinero no continuo y se dedicó a los trabajos domésticos junto a su mamá. Actualmente, la actividad productiva de la señora es la venta de mariscos, ya que sus hijos son los que pescan y ella es quien vende el producto a mayorista para su comercialización. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para realizar mejoras a su vivienda (techo),comprara madera y teja ella ve la imperiosa necesidad de realizar mejoras por tener problemas principalmente en la época lluviosa. La señora ha utilizado muy bien sus créditos ya que ha realizado mejoras a sus equipos de pesca (redes) y con ello sus ingresos también han aumentado. Las metas a un corto plazo es que sus hijos puedan construir cada uno sus casa ya que tienen familias a su cargo y le gustaría que cada uno se independice para tener mayor privacidad.
texts.en:
Adela lives with her 3 children who work in small scale fishing. When she was in school, she only went as far as the third grade of primary school. Due to a lack of money, she didn't continue and started to do housework with her mother. Right now, her productive activity is selling seafood. Her children fish and she sells the product to a wholesaler to be marketed.  

The loan she is asking for is to make improvements on her home (on the roof). She will buy wood and roof tiles because she has an urgent need to make improvements because she is having problems, especially during the rainy season. She has used her loans very well because she has made some improvements on her fishing equipment (on the nets). With that, her income has also increased. Her short term goals are for each of her children to be able to build a home because they have their own families and she would like for each one to become independent to have more privacy.

loans.use: to buy wood and tiles to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Manuelita

texts.en:
Manuelita is 60 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising chickens in the Philippines. Manuelita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Manuelita has been raising chickens for three years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, oil, tomato salsa, and cheese for her business.

loans.name: Da

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Da is 41 years old. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is very young, two are still in school, and other one is in university. She struggles for a living via rubber planting and cassava growing to earn extra income.

This is first time for Da with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree, majoring in Engineering. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree majoring in Engineering.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: A famer living in Takeo province, Saran is 54 years old and the mother of four children. To support her family, she weaves Cambodian skirts called "hul". Moreover, she grows rice to earn extra income. For Saran, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay her son's school fees so he can pursue a bachelor degree in engineering and buy school materials. She expects that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay her son's school fees so he can pursue a bachelor degree in engineering and buy school materials.

loans.name: Chamroeurn

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham province, Chamroeurn is 29 years old and a father of one child. He grows cassava on one and half hectares as his single source of income, earning about 7.81 USD per day. 

This is Chamroeurn's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He wants to focus on his younger sister's education. He has applied for a new loan in order to pay for tuition fees for his sister who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Banking and Tourism. He hopes that his sister can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his sister who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in Banking and Tourism.

loans.name: Urozoy

texts.en:
At the age of 76, Urozoy is still active and engaged in her favorite business - growing plants. Urozoy is a widow who lives in Vakhsh district with her two daughters, sons and daughters-in-law. Her daughters and daughters-in-law help Urozoy with the farming. They work hard and enjoy receiving the fruits of their labors. 

Urozoy and her family have been farming for over 8 years. At the moment, they have prepared the ground for the next crop. Urozoy has applied for a loan to buy wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers. She hopes to complete sowing in time and relies on your support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seed and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana de 39 años de edad se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, Ana vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 39 years old and makes and sells tortillas out of her home and has many customers.  Ana lives in a home of her own with her husband and two children.  She is asking for this loan to buy dried corn in quantity, and lime so she can continue making tortillas, and have a better income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime.

loans.name: Benito Nolasco

texts.es: Don Benito de 60 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados y ya tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Don Benito vive en casa propia con su esposa y su nieto, el esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Benito is 60 years old and sells clothing on foot, at various markets.  He has many steady customers because of the quality of his clothing and the good prices.  Benito lives in a home of his own with his wife and nephew.  He is asking for this loan to buy more clothing to continue his sales and be able to have a better income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Bety Jander

texts.es: Bety de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de naranjas, la fruta la comercializa en su pick up por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas naranjas por mayor ya que ha tenido buenos resultados y asi podrá tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Bety is 42 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner.  She sells oranges out of her pick-up truck, in the various neighborhoods and she is able to obtain some income to pay for some of the household expenses.  She is asking for a loan to buy more oranges in quantity, since she has had good results and this will allow her to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy oranges.

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad vive en asa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 30 años, posee muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos por los buenos precios, ella solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por mayor y cal para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi poder tener una mejor calidad d vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 59 years old and lives in a home of her own with her life’s partner and her son.  She has been selling tortillas for 30 years and has many customers, especially her neighbors because of her good prices.  She is asking for a loan to buy dried corn in quantity, and lime so she can continue working, as this is her only source of income.  This will allow her to have a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio el cual es la venta de abarrotería en general su negocio lo atiende todos los días de la semana, sus principales clientes vecinos de su comunidad y empleados de la fabrica que se ubica frente a su casa.
Doña Gloria se levanta muy temprano y tiene 17 años de experiencia en esta actividad, este negocio ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos y gracias a la buena administración ha sacado adelante a su familia, con el apoyo del credito anterior surtió su negocio, pero como la demanda de clientela que ha incrementado está solicitando nuevamente el apoyo del préstamo para comprar azúcar, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, manteca, café, aguas, harina, etc. y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Doña Gloria sueña con expandir su negocio y mejorar su fuente de ingresos. 


Danlí , Honduras - Octubre 2014
texts.en:
Gloria is a very hardworking woman and dedicated to her business selling groceries. She works in her store every day of the week and her principal customers are her neighbors in the community and employees from the factory that is opposite her house. 
Gloria gets up very early and has 17 years of experience in this work. This business has been her main source of income and, thanks to her good management, has enabled her to raise her family. With the help of her last loan, she stocked her business. But, demand from her customers has increased so she is requesting a new loan to buy sugar, beans, rice, butter, coffee, water, flour, etc, to meet the demands of her customers. 
Gloria dreams of expanding her business and improving her source of income. 

Danlí, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, butter,coffee, flour, etc, for her business.

loans.name: 16-08-03 Phố 5 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Quyên works in agriculture, growing vegetables and flowers. She is applying for a loan to purchase more seed to grow vegetables and flowers to sell. 

Quyên is 44 years old and she is married with 3 children.She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Quyên is the group leader of the 16-08-03 Phố 5 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

This is Quyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.The main hardship that Quyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Quyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds to grow vegetables and flowers to sell.

loans.name: 16-08-02 Phố 5 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Sự works in agriculture planting flowers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more seeds to grow flowers to sell. 

Sự is 33 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.She is the group leader of the 16-08-02 Phố 5 Đông Cương solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 


This is Sự's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Sự faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Sự hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more seed to grow flowers to sell.

loans.name: 16-08-05 Phố 5 Đông Cương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuyên, 55 years old, is the leader of a 6-member group, the 16-08-05 Phố 5 Đông Cương solidarity group. She has operated a retail business selling medication for more than 10 years. Xuyên is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to resell.

Xuyên is married and has 2 children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Xuyên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital. With her business profit, Xuyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to resell

loans.name: Emilyn

texts.en:
Emilyn is an entrepreneur, selling agrivet supplies like pig and chicken feeds. She is 43 years old, a  married woman, and has four children. The youngest child is 6 years old. In addition to that, she also in the rice retailing business. She sells rice on a wholesale and retail basis. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years.

 Emilyn has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP  buy additional sacks of rice and feeds. These will help Emilyn and her family improve their daily earnings and be able to provide her children with proper diets and good living conditions.

 Emilyn hopes to have a stable income that would help the family's livelihood be sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice and feed

loans.name: Mercedes Rosario

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres  hijos de 14, 13 y 9  años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y el menor  en  escuela. El marido trabaja con maquinaria pesada.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar para ganar sus propios ingresos y con estos ayudar con los gastos que generan sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon, Yanbal y Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días ya sea en su casa o realizando sus recorridos ya que ella donde sea que va lleva su revista en la cual enseña sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva en este negocio por más de 8 años el cual le deja muy buenos ingresos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Amigas Solidarias lending group meets every two weeks in the Crucita Parrish, area of the Portoviejo settlement.  This area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this beautiful place and are well visited by local and international tourists.  It’s known as “Crucita la Bella.”

Mercedes lives here.  She is 34 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has three children ages 14, 13, and 9.  The older children attend high school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband works with heavy equipment.

Mercedes is a very striving woman who likes to work in order to earn an income of her own to help pay for her children’s expenses.  She is a merchant who sells Avon, Yanbal, and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery, and ladies’ accessories).  She works daily, either out of her home or making her rounds.  She takes her catalogs everywhere, shows her products, and sells on credit.  She collects on the weekends.  She has been doing this for more than eight years and it provides her with a good income.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  She has been with the lending group from the start and she likes it because of the loans she is able to get.  Her dream is to be able to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Dolores Esperanza

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo de Crédito Amigas Solidarias, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 57 años de edad, hace algunos años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos mayores de edad. Ella hace años atrás aprendió corte y confección en una academia local.
Doña Dolores con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, allí se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa,  trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que siempre le llevan sus trabajos, en ciertas temporadas elabora uniformes de colegios y escuelas del cantón en estos días es cuando más trabajo tiene y mejores ganancias le deja su actividad. Lleva más de 40 años con esta actividad con la cual saco adelante a sus hijos.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The Amigas Solidarias lending group meets every two weeks in the Crucita Parrish, area of the Portoviejo settlement.  This area is known for the beautiful beaches that surround this beautiful place and are well visited by local and international tourists.  It’s known as “Crucita la Bella.”

Dolores lives here.  She is 57 years old.  Her husband passed away a few years ago and she became a widow, but she has three adult children.  Years ago she learned to make clothing at a local trade school.

Dolores set up a small sewing workshop in her home so she could take advantage of her skills and generate an income of her own.  There she makes all types of clothing to order for individuals who always bring her work.  During certain times of the year, she makes uniforms for the local schools and this is when she has the greatest amount of work and income.  She has been doing this for 40 years and she was able to support her children this way.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.  She has been with the lending group since the start and she likes it because the loans are a great help.  Her dream is to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy fabric and supplies.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan greatly enriched her business. She was able to purchase additional ready-to-wear items and other merchandise products needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional stock of clothing items for men and women and other merchandise of the same kind. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed at her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Marites wants to save for her own house and she dreams of having her own family someday. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of children's, men's and women's clothing needed in her business.

loans.name: Elemie

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Elemie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Elemie is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell at her general store business.

Elemie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Erlinda

texts.es:
María vive junto a sus 2 hijos quienes se dedican a la agricultura. María desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de frutas en el punto de buses de su comunidad y es ahí donde a todos los pasajeros les ofrece su producto, ella aparte de esta actividad también es responsable de los oficios de su casa. 

Tomo la decisión de dedicarse a dicha actividad a raíz de la cercanía que existe de donde vende y su residencia lo cual le minimiza los costos. María se traslada a la ciudad a compra por mayoreo la fruta para que pueda rendirle ganancias al momento de comercializarlas. 

El crédito lo solicita para utilizarlo como capital de trabajo y con ello obtener ganancias para cubrir los gastos dentro de su hogar.  Comprara especificamente, naranja, papaya, mango, jicama, jocote y otra fruta de temporada. Al tener financiamiento con Credicampo María ha logrado salir adelante con sus hijos y poder tener seguridad alimenticia. 

Sus aspiraciones a futuro cercano están enfocadas en mejorar las condiciones de su casa de habitación, ya que para la época de invierno tiene filtraciones de agua y se llena de agua su casa.
texts.en:
María lives with her 2 children who work in agriculture. Since she was very young, María has worked selling fruit at the bus station in her community. That is where she offers her products to all of the passengers. In addition to this activity, she is responsible for the housework. 

She decided to work in this activity because she her residence and the place where she sells are close, and that minimizes the cost. María goes to the city to buy the fruit wholesale so that she can profit when she sells it. 

She is asking for the loan to use it as working capital so she can make profit and cover the household expenses. Specifically, she will buy oranges, papaya, mango, jicama, jocote and other fruit in season. With the financing from Credicampo, María has been able to get ahead with her children and be able to have food security. 

Her goals for the future are focused on improving the conditions of her home, since in the winter water leaks in and the house is full of water.

loans.use: to buy oranges, papaya, mango, jicama, jocote, and other seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: A villager in Kampong Thom province, Ya is 29 years old and single. He can earn income to support his family condition via rice cropping and fish-catching. For Ya, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He will spend his entire loan portion to pay for his university fees. He hopes that he can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Yolanda Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yolanda de 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 3, 5 y 8 años de edad todos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica por falta de recursos económicos. Su esposo es a agricultor y en ocasiones trabaja como albañil, también apoya a su esposa en algunas actividades.

Yolanda es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de especias y condimento, compra  las especias por libra y luego las embolsa con ayuda de su suegra para después recorrer la comunidad ofreciendo el producto. El 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar sandalias, blusas, pantalones camisas y ropa de niños y niñas, para iniciar un nuevo negocio en su casa que por su experiencia espera que le vaya muy bien. También apoyara a su esposo en la compra de insumos agrícolas.

Yolanda espera que con el fruto de su trabajo sus hijos logren graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
30 year old Yolanda is married and has 3 children who are 3, 5, and 8 years old and are all studying at the community school. She only studied until the 3rd grade of elementary school because of a lack of economic resources. Her husband is a farmer and sometimes works as a mason and he also helps his wife with some work. 
Yolanda is in business - she sells spices and condiments. She buys the spices by the pound and then bags them with the help of her mother-in-law so she can go around the community selling her products. 
This loan will be used to buy sandals, blouses, pants, shirts, and children's clothes to start a new business in her home which, given her experience, she hopes will do very well. She will also help her husband to buy agricultural supplies. 
Yolanda hopes that, with the fruit of her labor, her children are able to graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy sandals, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Gretchen Faith

texts.en:
Gretchen Faith, 24, is a resident of Malibay, Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edison, who drives their van for rent, and has one child who is still in the preparatory level at school. Gretchen Faith and her husband try their best to start a happy family and to work to support their everyday needs.   

Gretchen Faith operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, manicures, pedicures and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day from her salon and 15,000 PHP monthly from the van rental business.

To help her continue and improve operations of her business, Gretchen Faith is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to buy hair color, hair rebonding, a hair blower, a hair iron and other beauty products. She will use part of the loan for the maintenance of her van. Gretchen Faith is positive that her salon will attract more customers as she updates and add new beauty supplies. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Gretchen Faith dreams of being able to give her child the best education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her child to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

Rhea would now like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan, which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods to sell at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Rhea's income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and her child's education. Rhea thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Rhea dreams of having a grocery store someday and aims to give her children the best education for a better future. Every week, Rhea meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This borrower's name is Editha, 48, resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Maximiano, a welder and has three children. One is in college, one in high school, and one in elementary level. Editha manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her children to school. 

Editha operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also has a tricycle unit for transport service which her husband drives for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 1000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, charcoal, sodas and other grocery stuff. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Editha hopes to maintain and grow her business so she can have a better life. She strives to give her children the best education and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Merlisa

texts.en:
Merlisa is 49 years old and has three children.  Merlisa is married and has two children who are in school.

Merlisa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Merlisa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Merlisa has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlisa would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and pig fattening businesses. Renelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to customers.

Renelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marina De La Cruz

texts.es:
El préstamo será utilizado para comprar golosinas, bebidas y productos de canasta básica para abastecer su tienda ya que al pagar medicamentos para que su pareja se recuperara de un accidente se quedó sin capital para invertir en su tienda.

Marina espera Dios le presta vida para seguir apoyando a su pareja en el cuido de sus hijos y mantenimiento del hogar.
texts.en:
The loan will be used to buy snacks, beverages and staple products to stock her store so that her spouse can recover from an accident. She was left with no capital to invest in her store.  

Marina hopes that God will give keep giving her life to keep helping her spouse and to care for her children and support the home.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and staple products.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 30 years. She sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

Virginia has requested a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Virginia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Cham province, Nat is 38 years old and a mother of three children. To earn a living for her family, she grows rice on three hectares' area and grows cassava on a half hectare area. Moreover, she buys chickens for resale to earn extra income to support her family. 

For Nat, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree, majoring in Law. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue his Bachelor's degree, majoring in Law.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
This is the story of Stephen:
"My name is Stephen, I come from North Sumatra, precisely in the city of Medan. The atmosphere in my city is very crowded, congested with vehicles. I am the first child of six siblings, four of my brothers are in school and one not yet in school. My father is not working and my mother work as a seamstress. My mother's income is uncertain, depending on the people who want to sew clothes by my mother or not. Because she is engaged in this service, so the mother has to serve with the best effort. Customer satisfaction is to be expected and my mother struggles to give good results for her customers. However, I am very sad, seeing my mother, having to fend for her self to support me and my five brothers. Since I am the eldest child, I hope to take higher education to help my parents and my brothers. With the loan from Kiva program at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN), I apply for this loan, to finance my college for 3 years at AMN. With this loan may be able to ease the burden on my parents. Thanks to the lender, may God bless you."

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a young married woman who is 27 this year. She works at a local school as a teacher. She loves children, but so far she has no children of her own.
 
Manzura lives in the town of Kulob with her husband, mother-in-law and father-in-law. At present, her husband and father-in-law are in Russian for work. They work there for several months at a time. 

In her free time, Manzura is engaged in sewing. She takes orders for tailoring the national dress for women. She began this business three years ago as an additional source of income. Now, she is interested in developing her sewing business. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to purchase a new embroidery machine. 

She needs this loan.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 59, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She has three children who are already working. She manages her household while also operating the business. She works hard to support herself and help her grandchildren in their school needs.

Editha operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products sold are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She is also a dealer of personal beauty products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day. 

To help her expand her general store business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal, soda, and other grocery stuff. She will use part of it to pay for personal beauty products to sell. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her earnings are used to meet her daily expenses and to send her grandchildren to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Editha hopes to maintain and grow her business so she can save for her old age. She prays to stay strong and healthy to assist her grandchildren in their school needs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Marilyn

texts.en:
Ma. Marilyn, 38, is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is single and works hard to meet her daily basic personal and household needs and to support her aging parents.

Ma. Marilyn has a food business, having operated an eatery stall for a number of years. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight, especially in populated areas. Working class people usually buy their meals at food stalls as the food is sold at reasonable prices, it is convenient and it saves money rather than cooking at home. The working class just eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family. Ma. Marilyn cooks well, so her food stall is popular with neighbors and the local working community as her regular customers. Ma. Marilyn earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 daily.

To help maintain her business, Ma. Marilyn is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to buy additional raw ingredients such as pork, fish, chicken and seasonings that are needed for her cooking. She believes that, with this financial assistance, her sales and earnings will increase. Ma. Marilyn thanks God and you in advance for your great help that will enable her to support herself and the medical needs of her aging parents.

Ma. Marilyn dreams of having a small restaurant someday. She wants to have a better life and save for her future. Ma. Marilyn meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients needed for her business.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina estudio hasta tercer grado, en la catualidad esta acompañada, pero hace ocho años decidieron casarse pues ya tienen cuatro hijos de las edades de 19, 14, 9 y una ultima de 4 años de edad, con lo cual ya considera que su hogar esta firme y trabajan a la par para poder tener siempre el alimento para su hogar. 

Reina vende productos por catalogo, ya tiene nueve años de dedicarse a la venta de estos productos dice que le es bastante favorable lo que a ella le ingresa, es por eso que ella con las ganas enormes que le pone al trabajo puede ver el fruto que cosecha, andando por algunos cantones vecinos de ella, su forma de trasladarse lo hace caminando, pues andar de casa en casa no le es facil pero que con el tiempo que lleva de hacerlo ya siente que hasta falta le hace cuando no sale. Ella sale un dia por medio a vender los productos sale de su casa a las 8 am y regresa como a eso de las 3 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar lociones, cosmeticos, cremas, ropa, para vender. 
Los sueños son mantener su negocio, que Dios les llene de bendiciones y que sus hijos puedan estudiar ya que ella no pudo hacerlo.
texts.en:
Reina went to school up to third grade. RIght now, she is married. They decided to marry eight years ago because they already have four children, aged 19, 14, 9 and the youngest, who is 4. She considers her home to be stable now and the two of them work to be able to always have food for the home. 

Reina sells products by catalog. For nine years, she has been selling these products. She says that what she earns is very favorable. That is why, with the enormous enthusiasm she puts into her work, she can see the result she reaps. She goes to some neighboring cantons on foot. Going house to house isn't easy but with the time she has been doing it, she misses it when she doesn't do it. She usually leaves her house at 8 a.m. and returns at 3 p.m.  

The loan she is asking for is to buy lotions, cosmetics, creams, and clothing to sell. Her dream is to maintain her business, and for God to fill her with blessings and for her children to be able to go to school, since she wasn't able to.

loans.use: to buy lotions, cosmetics, creams, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es:
José estudio hasta segundo grado de educacion basica, comenta que él queria seguir estudiando pero los padres no tenian los recursos economicos para darle mas estudio, ya que ahi solo trabajo le ofrecian. José trabaj la agricultara desde muy pequeño, debido a que sus padres eso le enseñaron. Siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados de maíz en su terreno.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar un saco de abono y pago de mano de obra para sacar la cosecha de maíz. 

 Entre sus deseos a futuro son que Dios le permita gozar de buena salud y que su esposa tambien este sana, que sus hijos aunque no esten con él que puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
José went to school up to second grade of primary school. He says that he wanted to keep going to school but his parents didn't have enough resources to give him more education, because they could only offer him work. José has worked in agriculture since he was very young, because that is what his parents taught him. He plants 10,500 square meters of corn on his land.  


The loan he is asking for is to buy a sack of fertilizer and to pay for labor to bring in the corn harvest. 

Among the things he wants in the future are for God to let him keep enjoying good health and for his wife to be healthy as well, and for his children, although the aren't with him, to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy a sack of fertilizer and to pay for labor to bring in the corn harvest.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 55 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 21 years. She sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

Nenita has requested a loan of 22,000 Phillipine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional groceries to sell.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Roselia

texts.es: Roselia de 56 años de edad es viuda y vive en casa propia con su hijo, desde hace 14 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado en la zona donde reside, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio, por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y la compra de mas ganado que le permita crecer en el negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Roselia is 56 years old and a widow.  She lives in a home of her own with her son and has been raising livestock in her area for 14 years.  She sells them in the surrounding villages and has steady customers.  She has decided to invest into caring for her livestock since her business depends on it.  She is asking for this loan to buy more livestock so she can grow her business and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Choeun's Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Speu province, Choeun is 54 years old and the mother of three children. To support her family, she harvests rice and raises chickens. She can earn about 20,000 Cambodian riels per day. 

This is her fifth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

For this new loan, she is leading a group of five members. As the group leader, she is applying for a loan to build a decent latrine. 

She hopes that her family has a decent latrine to use.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine, 30 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. Geraldine works hard to provide for her family. For the past 6 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from pig fattening. 

Geraldine has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Geraldine has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough money to continue to send her children to school and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agua Dulce 27 Group

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 65 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 21 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de pescado frito.
Ella es emprendedora, constante, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el mercado de la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ un lugar estratégico caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante todo tipo de transporte, donde la gente se aglomera para conseguir movilidad a su hogar, de clima frío y seco a una altura promedio de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Teresa es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español según la lengua de sus clientes(al medio de pie, suéter rojo entero). Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que es electricista y trabaja en una empresa del rubro y su hijo que estudia en la universidad la carrera técnica de enfermería, todos viven en una casa a medio construir de ladrillo y adobe, cuentan con agua, electricidad y gas. La necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de ropa, venta de fruta, venta de tomates, tejidos, venta de pescado, servicio de construcción y venta de empanadas para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de pescado frito, actividad que viene desarrollando desde hace ocho años. 
Ya es media mañana y los transeúntes de la zona empiezan a oler el delicioso aroma del pescado frito proveniente del mercado, más de uno no logra resistir su antojo y se apersonan hasta el puesto de venta para pedirle un plato de comida, el lugar es pequeño, tiene dos mesas que siempre se encuentran llenas, pero para complacer  a sus clientes tiene varios banquitos para sentarse y comer; en una mano agarran el plato y con la otra la cuchara, no falta el cliente que come de pié por falta de sillas. Por fin termina el día; ella lava sus ollas, guarda sus utensilios y se marcha a su hogar, su casa es acogedora, tiene un perro que la espera en la puerta. Se aproxima la época de lluvias y el techo se encuentra malogrado, filtra agua y esta se derrama sobre los muebles, la cama y todo su domicilio.
Su sueño es terminar la construcción de su hogar y desea realizar una inversión en la refacción de su techo y la muralla de su casa. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en ocho años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Tereza solicita un préstamo para la refacción de su vivienda y poder dormir sin filtraciones de agua.
texts.en:
Teresa is a woman of 65 years, married, she has one son aged 21. Her business is the sale of fried fish. She is enterprising, steadfast, responsible, a good mother and worker. She carries out her business in the market of the 'cruce Villa Aldea' zone, a place strategically characterized by connecting various zones of the city by all types of transport, where the people agglomerate to find transit to their homes, a zone of cold and dry climate at an elevation of 3800 meters above sea level.

Teresa is of dark complexion, long black hair, short stature, her native tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish according to the language of her customers (in the middle standing, whole red sweater). She carries out her life with her husband who is an electrician and works in a business of such. Their son studies the technical career of nursing at the university. All live in a halfway-constructed house of brick and adobe. They have water, electricity and gas.

The need of improving their quality of life led her to form a bank of people with businesses like: clothing sale, sale of fruit, sale of tomatoes, knit garments, sale of fish, construction service and sale of empanadas in order to apply for a loan and fulfill their goals. Her business is the sale of fried fish, an activity that she's been developing since 8 years ago.

It's already midmorning and the passersby of the zone start to smell the delicious aroma of fried fish coming from the market. More than one can't achieve resisting his appetite and they come up to the stall to order a plate of food from her. The place is small, it has two tables that are always found full, but in order to satisfy her customers, she has various benches to sit down and eat. In one hand they hold the plate and with the other, the spoon. There isn't a lack of customers who eat standing up for lack of seats. Finally the day finishes; she washes the pots, puts away her utensils and heads to her home. Her house is cozy, she has a dog that waits for her at the door. The rainy season is getting close and the roof is found ill-fated, water leaks and this floods on top of the furniture, the bed and all of her home.

Her dream is to finish the construction of her home and she wishes to carry out an investment in repairing her roof and the wall of her house. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the eight years that she's been developing this activity.

It's for these reasons that Tereza applies for a loan for the repair of her home and to be able to sleep without water leaks.

loans.use: to repair her home and be able to sleep without water leaks.

loans.name: Magdalena Salome

texts.es: Salome es una joven casada, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en la casa de su padre con su esposo, su hija de 6 años y esta esperando el nacimiento de su bebe, Salome esta estudiando y para apoyar  a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa comenta que su aspiración es seguir adelante con su negocio y tener algún ahorro para la llegada de su bebe y para darle lo que su hija necesita para que siga estudiando.
texts.en: Salome is a young married woman. She's 26, lives in the house of her father with her husband, her daughter of 6 years and is waiting for the birth of her baby. Salome is studying and to be able to support her husband in the expenses of the home, she works selling clothing. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of clothes. She comments that her dream is to get ahead with her business and have some savings for the arrival of her baby and to be able to give her daughter what she needs to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Umme  Kalsoom

texts.en:
Umme  Kalsoom, 48, is a housewife and the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges from his shop.
 
Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to provide more variety. Therefore, his wife has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.
 
With this loan, Umme Kalsoom can help her husband purchase more varieties of fruit from the field to sell in the market at a profit. With his profits, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Umme  Kalsoom is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit selling business

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 42-year-old married woman, and she is the mother of four children. 

Gulnaz has started a clothing business. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market. 

Presently, Gulnaz needs to purchase some winter seasonal wear clothes to sell. However, due to a lack of finances, she is facing a problem. For that reason, Gulnaz is requesting a loan from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to enhance her own clothing sale business

loans.name: Andresa

texts.es:
Andresa es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas, y es gracias a estas ventas que esta logrando salir adelante. Comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior ella pudo comprar prendas variadas para poder venderlas, y las cuales le ha ayudado mucho para poder continuar con su trabajo.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Andresa is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. She makes a living selling various garments. It's thanks to these sales that she's achieving getting ahead. She comments that by means of her previous loan, she was able to buy various garments able to sell them. These have helped her a lot to be able to continue with her work.

Today she applies for a new loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of various garments for selling like t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans and more, so that she can continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans and more.

loans.name: Neheru Group

texts.en:
Rasmita is an inhabitant of J.K.Pur village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing at the extreme left with raised hand in the photo is Rasmita. She is 26 years old and resides with her husband and one son. The main source of income for Rasmita is tailoring. Rasmita does the tailoring job and her husband helps in marketing. 

Rasmita has been doing this tailoring profession for the last four years and the earning is just hand to mouth for her family. The family income of Rasmita is about 4,800/- INR per month. So to overcome this situation, in the year 2013 she formed a Self Help Group comprising four members and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. This will be her second cycle loan.

From this loan amount she will purchase a Pico machine, cloth, thread and needles. This loan will definitely bring more income to her. Rasmita hopes to construct a house and give a better life to her children.

The other three members of the group are doing milk business, scrap material business, a leaf plate business and hotel.

loans.use: to purchase a Pico machine, cloth, thread and needles

loans.name: Diana Madelayne

texts.es: A sus 55 años de edad Diana  se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos y productos de bisutería, ella vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo con su esposo, sus 2 hijos viven en otra ciudad por motivo de estudios, Diana también se dedica a  cuidar a una niña, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y productos de bisutería que los comercializa por catalogo, la aspiración de Diana es mejorar su ventas, comprar mas productos y ofrecer variedad en los mismos, para mejorar sus ingresos, también desea comprar una casa para ella y su familia.
texts.en: At her 55 years of age, Diana works selling cosmetics and jewelry. She lives in a house for which she pays rent with her husband. Their two children live in another city because of their studies. Diana also works caring for a girl. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of cosmetics and jewelry products which she sells by catalog. Diana's dream is to improve her sales, buy more products and offer variety of products, to improve her income. She also wishes to buy a house for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
Flocerfida sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly assisted her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery items needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

She is very positive that she can further improve more her business if you will lend her the amount of 25,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional stocks of groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products. Her customers will likely buy more items if she has more products on display in her store. An increase on sales will significantly increase her profit, which will aid her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Flocerfida hopes to grow her business and she dreams of giving her family a good life. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yessenia Estefania

texts.es: Estefania tiene 23 años de edad, ella se encuentra estudiando y comenta que viaja de una ciudad a otra para asistir a clases, Estefania vive con su tia ya que sus padres fallecieron cuando ella era una niña, para apoyarse en sus gastos de transporte y estudios se dedica a la venta ropa y de productos de belleza, el crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de ropa, la aspiración de Estefania es mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ventas para que le quede mas ganancias y lograr terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Estefania is 23. She is found studying and comments that she travels from one city to another to go to classes. Estefania lives with her aunt, since her parents passed away when she was a girl. To support herself in the expenses of transportation and studies, she works selling clothing and beauty products. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of clothing. Estefania's dream is to improve her business and by such her sales, so that she has more profit and achieves finishing her studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr.  Jose tiene 32 años , esta en pareja con la Sra. Luz ellos tiene un hijo que esta en la escuela, y quien es el principal motor de lucha de ambos.
Don Jose se inició en este rubro hace más de 3 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2.011, el comenzó con el capital que le presto su familia para trabajar en compra venta de artículos de primera necesidad, y luego cambio de rubro, para comenzar a distribuir calzados deportivos y ropas en general, ya tiene una muy buena clientela que siempre compra de él los productos que vende.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos deportivos y prendas en general para poder vender y seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jose is 32, he is in a relationship with Luz. They have a son who is in school; he is their primary motivation to work hard. Jose started in this field more than three years ago, approximately since year 2011. He started with capital that his family lent him to work in retailing staple goods, and later he changed fields, to start distributing athletic shoes and clothing in general. He already has a very good clientele who always buys the products he sells from him.

He asks for this loan to be able to buy athletic clothing and clothing in general to be able to sell and continue with his work like he's doing.

loans.use: to buy athletic clothing and clothes in general.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Martha de 35 años de edad, es soltera y tiene una hija de 7 años de edad que está estudiando 1° grado de educación básica. Vive con su madre y su hija, y solo su hija depende de ella.

Martha es costurera, tiene 15 años de experiencia, trabaja en su casa, así está pendiente de su hija, también ayuda a su madre con la venta de tortillas.  El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una vaca lechera para hacer charamuscas y paletas que tanto le demandan sus clientes.

Sueña con poder preparar a su hija académicamente y poder crecerla de la mejor manera que nunca le falte lo necesario para que pueda tener una vida tranquila
texts.en:
Martha is 35 years old, single and has one seven-year-old daughter who is in first grade. Martha lives with her mother and daughter; only her daughter depends on her.

Martha is a seamstress. She has 15 years experience and works from home in order to look after her daughter. Martha also helps her mother to sell tortillas. This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow in order to make the candy twists and ice-lollies that are high in demand with customers.

Martha dreams to being able to give her daughter a good education and to raise her well so that she may never need for anything and can have a life free of worries.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 41 years old and married with two children; both of them are in school. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kokui

texts.fr: KOKUI est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants; elle est commerçante de gingembre et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé, mais vit à Tokoin, puis à un niveau primaire et se nourrit deux fois par jours. KOKUI désire un microcrédit pour appuyer son commerce, acheter beaucoup plus de gingembres pour satisfaire sa clientèle et assurer le bien-être de sa famille puis soulager son mari dans les dépenses du foyer.
texts.en: KOKUI, aged 37, is a married mother of three children. She is a vendor of ginger and gets her supplies three times a month at the Grand Market of Lomé, but she is living in Tokoin. She has an elementary school education and eats twice a day. KOKUI would like a micro-loan to support her business, to buy more ginger for satisfying her customer, and to ensure her family’s well-being, and also to help out her husband in covering household expense.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of ginger

loans.name: Yolanda Marlene

texts.es: Yolanda  es una señora separada de su esposo, ella tiene 4 hijos de 4, 6, 8 y 10 años de edad de los cuales 3 asisten a la escuela y el de 8 años no estudia ya que tiene una discapacidad en el cerebro y a él le lleva su madre a la terapia, Yolanda se dedica  a la crianza y comercialización de chanchos, el crédito lo necesita para comprar chanchos y asi seguir trabajando, la aspiración de Yolanda es mejorar su negocio, hacer buenas ventas y que le quede buenas ganancias para cubrir todos los gastos que tiene de hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda  is separated from her husband. She has four children aged 4, 6, 8 and 10. Three of them study at school, but the 8-year-old doesn't study because she has a brain disability and his mother takes him to therapy. 

Yolanda makes a living raising and selling pigs. She needs the loan to buy pigs and in this way, keep working. Yolanda dreams of improving her business, and making good sales and a good profit to cover all of her children's costs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her one son. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years; he is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Nazia is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
Nazia needs different kinds of goods (e.g. needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil and so on) for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. 

Therefore, Nazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business by purchasing tailoring accessories

loans.name: Kossiwavi  Délali

texts.fr: Agée de 47 ans, KOSSIWA est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires et s’approvisionne  deux fois par mois au marché de Gbossimé, mais loge à Tokoin, ayant un niveau secondaire, se nourrit une fois par jour et le foyer ne dispose pas de moyen de déplacement. KOSSIWA sollicite un prêt pour étendre son commerce et gagner plus de bénéfices afin de réaliser ses rêves et surtout plus s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en: KOSSIWA, aged 47, is a married mother of two children. She sells grocery items and gets her supplies twice a month at the Gbossimé market, but she is living in Tokoin. She has a middle school education and eats once a day. Her family lacks transportation. KOSSIWA is requesting a loan to expand her business and to earn more profit, so as to realize her dreams and especially to take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bowls of cassava flour, 8 bowls of peanuts, and 12 kg of sugar

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es: Doña Ana vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortas y hamburguesas desde hace 10 años, tiene muy buena clientela pues vende su comida a un buen precio, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Ana solicita un crédito que le permita poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus tortas y hamburguesas como: pan, tomates, cebollas, mayonesa, mortadelas, entre otros ingredientes y poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en su casa con los gastos que se le puedan presentar.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her three children in a house that she owns.  She has a business selling sandwiches and hamburgers, which she has run for the past 10 years.  She has a very good customer base because she sells her food at good prices.  Her business is located near her home.  With her earnings, she is able to cover some of her household expenses.  

Ana is seeking a loan to purchase everything necessary to make her sandwiches and hamburgers such as: bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, bologna and other ingredients.  This will allow her to increase her earnings and continue helping in her household with the expenses that arise.

loans.use: purchase bread, tomatoes, onions, mayonnaise, bologna and other ingredients.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es: Yolanda de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 12 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, gelatinas, azúcar, productos de uso personal, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 40 years old and lives with her two children in a home that she owns.  For the past 12 years, she has run a small store from her home where she sells a variety of products such as snacks, beverages, basic grains, gelatins, sugar, personal care products and more items.  She has many customers based on her fair prices.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase more merchandise in bulk since this is her only source of income.  This will allow her to increase her earnings so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: purchase snacks, beverages, basic grains, gelatins, sugar, personal care products and more in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, biscuits and bread, candies and other snack foods, soap and toiletries and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Shoirajon

texts.en:
Shoirajon was born in 1992. She is a very hardworking and industrious woman. Shoirajon is married. Her husband is Osimjon. Osimjon is a waiter in a restaurant. Shoirajon and her husband bring up a child, who is 1 year old. 

Shoirajon is a young entrepreneur. She offers the service of sewing. Shoirajon began this business three years ago. Shoirajon sews two national women's dresses in a day. She is a very hardworking woman. 

She always tries to offer better service to her clients. So, she is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy an embroidery machine. This loan will help her to offer additional service to her clients, and in this way, to improve her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, 52, engages in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like sugar, spices, noodles, canned goods, soap, cooking oil, flour and soft drinks. She has 11 children, of whom four are still attending to school. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. She is also planning to raise pigs as an additional source of income. Jennifer is in need of capital to sustain her livelihood. 

Jennifer has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy assorted goods for the store and piglets. With these tools, she can now raise and sell healthy pigs in the future.

Jennifer hopes to have a stable source of  income that would help her send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods for the store and piglets

loans.name: Mahmadsobirjon

texts.en:
Mahmadsobirjon was born in 1994. He is a student of the 5th course at Tajikistan State University of Metallurgy. He studies at the faculty of providing manufacturing with electricity. He is one of the best students, and he learns all subjects well. 

Mahmadsobirjon hopes to be a good specialist. He is not married and lives with his parents in the north part of Tajikistan. He is asking for a loan to pay for tuition, as his parents do not have the opportunity to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: Floranie

texts.en:
Floranie sends you her thankfulness for your generosity because her previous loan greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional gadgets, accessories, clothing and other items needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow the amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional stocks of cellphones, tablets and other gadgets. She will also buy more shoes, clothing, bags, watches, and other items of the same kind. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also make her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could provide for the needs of her family.

Floranie wants to earn more and own a boutique. She also hopes to have her own house. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional mobile phones and other electronic gadgets for her inventory

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: DOPE, mariée et mère de deux enfants et âgée de 52 ans, est vendeuse des produits de beauté et autres, vivant au quartier Cassablanca ; elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et vit dans une maison dont le toit est en tôle, se soigne par automédication et se nourrit une fois par jour. DOPE demande un prêt pour soutenir son commerce  afin qu’elle puisse réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices et faire face aux besoins du foyer qui sont multiples.
texts.en: Dopé, a married mother of two, is 52 years old and a vendor of beauty products and more. She lives in the Cassablanca district; she gets her supplies once a month at the Grand Market of Lomé and lives in a house with a sheetmetal roof. She takes care of herself by self-medication and eats once a day. Dopé is asking for a loan to support her business, so that she may realize a lot of profit and cope with multiple household needs.

loans.use: to purchase100 pieces of clothing, 20 boxes of canned drinks, and 14 dozen earrings

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es: Eladio de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de sorbetes artesanales, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo ya que está bastante deteriorado por las lluvias, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en: Eladio is 46 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He sells artisan sorbets. With his earnings he is able to cover some of the household costs. He wants to make improvements to his house, changing the roof which has already suffered quite a lot of rain damage. He doesn't have enough earnings to carry out this work, so he is asking for a loan to buy metal sheets, poles, and to pay the workers so that his family can live in greater safety.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and poles and to pay workers

loans.name: Gulzora

texts.en:
