Sara tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica al comercio de granos, cultivos de frutales y ganadería, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bosques de algarrobo, a dos horas de la ciudad de Morropon, que se ubica a en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

La actividad que realiza Sara es comercio de granos, compra a agricultores de la zona (arroz frijol, soya, otros) y vende en el mercado de Chiclayo. La actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, dichos productos los compra y almacena en un local que a acondicionado en su domicilio. El destino del crédito es para capital de trabajo, es decir para comprar granos ya que es etapa de cosecha y los agricultores empiezan a ofertar sus productos cosechados. La inversión le ayudará incrementar las ventas y a obtener mayores ingresos para su familia. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que la zona es netamente agricola. Y en en todas las temporadas del año se oferta productos agricolas. Piensa seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que año tras año su negocio viene siendo mas conocido en la zona, así mismo sus ventas vienen creciendo. Y de esta manera obtener mejores ganancias que le permitan a un mediano o corto plazo aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sara is 48 years old and lives in the district of Buenos Aires, whose population works selling grains, fruit crops, and livestock; it is a community that is known for its forests of carob trees.  It is two hours from the city of Morropon, which is located in the region of Piura on Peru's northern coast.  

Sara has a business selling grains; she buys from local farmers (rice, beans, and soy, among others) and sells in the market of Chiclayo.  She has had this business for four years and she buys and stores her produce in an air-conditioned space in her home.  This loan will be used for working capital, which is to say to buy grains, as it is harvesting season and the farmers are starting to offer the produce they have harvested.  This investment will help her increase her sales and make better profits for her family.  The market offers good opportunities because the area is truly agrarian and farmed produce is sold during all seasons of the year.  She is planning to keep investing in her business, as year after year her business has become better known in the area and her sales have been increasing accordingly.  In this way her earnings will improve, which will increase her income in the mid to short term.

loans.use: to use as work capital, which is to say to buy grain as it is harvest season and the farmers are starting to sell their harvested produce.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina, 50 years old, is a married woman with eleven children. Three of her children are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, with a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Evelina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this loan to purchase more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Evelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a retail shop in Makueni town and has been running this business for 3 years. She is 23 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with one child. 

She will use this loan to buy more stock of flour, cereals, sugar and washing detergents to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to improve the living standards of her family. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and to be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall for her vegetable vending business.  Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years. She earns more income from general store.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Kairy

texts.ru: Кайры 59 лет, замужем, дети все взрослые, самостоятельные. Образование у Кайры среднее. С 2004 года она занимается животноводством, благодаря ее большому опыту и неустанному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Кайры есть 8 коров, 20 овец и 3 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en: Kairy is 59 years old and married.  All of her children are already grown up and independent.  Kairy has a secondary education.  She has been working in animal husbandry since 2004, and, thanks to her vast experience and tireless hard work, she now has 8 cows, 20 sheep, and 3 horses.  Her monthly income is about 15,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, she turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 KGS to increase the number of livestock in her care.  With the income from the loan she plans to save toward the further expansion of her business and toward building a stable for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania, 56, is married with six children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 10 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs.

She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase additional stock, and now she is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 57 years old and residing in Tugas, Tangub City. She is a widow and blessed with 4 children. She has recently joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. 

Now, she's accessing her 2nd loan in the amount of PHP 9,500 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of commodities to sell in their neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
For the last six years Monica has been selling bricks to her customers and earns a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is married and blessed with three school-going children.

She has applied for this first loan of 20,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more raw materials for making bricks to sell.

Monica will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of raw materials for making bricks
